0.title: Pic of Rishi, Neetu's reception card goes viral ahead of Ranbir, Alia's rumoured wedding
0.article_body: Ahead of Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's rumoured wedding, a picture of Ranbir's parents Rishi and Neetu Kapoor's reception card has gone viral. Their reception was held on January 23, 1980, a day after they got married. Several reports have claimed that Ranbir and Alia will get married this month.

1.title: Fintech firm Bolt to buy crypto firm Wyre in $1.5 bn deal: Reports
1.article_body: Payments-focused fintech firm Bolt Financial is buying crypto-services startup Wyre Payments in a $1.5 billion deal, Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday. This would be the largest merger in the crypto sector that didn't involve a special purpose acquisition company, according to research firm Dealogic. Wyre last year connected to the Visa network after joining its Fintech Fast Track Program.

2.title: MNS' Pune chief removed after his different view on loudspeakers' removal
2.article_body: The Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) has removed Vasant More as the party's Pune chief, days after he took a different stand on party chief Raj Thackeray's directive on the removal of loudspeakers from mosques. Thackeray has now appointed Sainath Babar as the party's Pune chief. More said that he was not asked or informed to resign from the post.

3.title: Entire Andhra Pradesh cabinet resigns as CM Jagan prepares new cabinet
3.article_body: As Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy is preparing a new cabinet, all 24 cabinet ministers resigned on Thursday after completing their final cabinet meeting. The ministers sent their resignations to Reddy at the state secretariat. Notably, the YSRCP chief had planned to reshuffle his cabinet in December 2021, but it was postponed due to the coronavirus pandemic.

4.title: Your brother stole all money: BharatPe CEO to Ashneer's sister on unpaid salaries
4.article_body: BharatPe CEO Suhail Sameer responded, "Your brother stole all the money...Very little left to pay salaries," to a comment by Ashneer Grover's sister on LinkedIn, criticising him for not paying salaries to some employees. Sameer later apologised and removed the comment. The comments were made on a LinkedIn post by a BharatPe employee who was demanding his salary for March.

5.title: May face impairment losses of up to $5 bn due to Russia exit: Shell
5.article_body: Oil and natural gas giant Shell is writing off $4 billion to $5 billion in assets after it pulled its operations in Russia. On March 8, Shell announced that it would exit the Russian oil and natural gas sector and close all its service stations in response to the Russia-Ukraine war. "These charges are expected to be identified," Shell said.

6.title: How much tax is collected in each state for petrol?
6.article_body: Petrol prices differ from state to state depending on local taxation (VAT) and freight charges apart from excise duty charged by the Centre. Taking ₹100/litre as base price of petrol for every state, an Indian Express infographic citing government data states that tax paid in Maharashtra is ₹65.22, Delhi is ₹48.5, Uttarakhand is ₹46.07, Karnataka is ₹55.02, Telangana is ₹64.3.

7.title: Russia facing most difficult situation in 3 decades amid sanctions: PM
7.article_body: Russian PM Mikhail Mishustin on Thursday said the country is facing the most difficult situation in three decades due to unprecedented Western sanctions over Ukraine. He, however, added that the foreign attempts to isolate Russia from the global economy would fail. Notably, the United States has announced new sanctions on Russian individuals, including President Vladimir Putin's two daughters.

8.title: Everyone should comply with K'taka HC's order on loudspeakers: Kharge
8.article_body: Congress' Mallikarjun Kharge said on Thursday that all communities must abide by Karnataka High Court's (HC) order to curb use of loudspeakers in religious institutions. He, however, added that such issues shouldn't be brought up for polarisation purposes. Kharge's comment comes after Karnataka government said it wants to implement HC's order on regulating sound volume of loudspeakers in mosques.

9.title: Coca-Cola to set up 2nd plant worth ₹1,000 cr in Telangana
9.article_body: Hindustan Coca-Cola Beverages on Thursday signed a partnership with the Telangana government and announced a fresh investment of ₹1,000 crore for setting up their second factory in the state. Coca-Cola will initially invest ₹600 crore in the new facility and add another ₹400 crore over the next five years, reports said. The facility will manufacture packaged beverages, juices and more.

10.title: Video shows AIMIM corporator arguing with police over parking in Hyd
10.article_body: A video shows AIMIM corporator Syed Sohail Quadri getting into an altercation with the police over a parking issue near the Mecca Mosque. Several vehicles were parked near the mosque and police had gone there to remove the vehicles. The corporator also spoke with the Superintendent of Police on the phone over the matter.

11.title: Will begin shooting for film with Akshay Kumar in 2023: Priyadarshan
11.article_body: Filmmaker Priyadarshan has said that the shooting of his upcoming film with actor Akshay Kumar will begin in 2023. "My film with Akshay is on the scripting stage. Few things are happening, and the film got delayed because of COVID-19," he said. Speaking about the sequel to his 2004 film 'Hulchul', Priyadarshan said, "I have not decided anything."

12.title: Manipur minister meets girl, who attended school with sister in lap
12.article_body: Manipur minister Thongam Biswajit Singh on Wednesday met Meiningsinliu Pamei, the 10-year-old girl who attended school while her two-year-old sister sat in her lap. Pamei's picture had gone viral earlier. "We have decided to assist her education through a boarding school and promised her parents that I will be looking after all her expenses till she graduates," Singh tweeted.

13.title: Russia's key objective is to capture all of Ukraine: Minister
13.article_body: Amid the ongoing Ukraine-Russia war, Ukrainian Deputy Defence Minister Hanna Malyar has said that Russia's long-term objective is to seize all of Ukraine. Malyar said, "The key objective of the Russian Federation was and is the capture of the entire territory of Ukraine." However, Russia said its "special military operation" in Ukraine is aimed at "demilitarising" and "denazifying" the country.

14.title: Muslim govt employees can leave offices 1 hr early during Ramzan in Andhra
14.article_body: The Andhra Pradesh government on Thursday said government employees, teachers, contractual employees and outsourcing officers, who follow Islam, can leave offices one hour early on all working days during Ramzan. They can leave early till May 2, the order signed by Chief Secretary Dr Sameer Sharma read. Earlier, Delhi Jal Board passed a similar order but withdrew it later.

15.title: SP MLA's petrol pump razed with bulldozers in UP, video surfaces
15.article_body: A petrol pump owned by SP MLA Shazil Islam Ansari was razed with bulldozers by district officials after claiming that it was built without necessary permission in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly. A video of the incident has surfaced online. This comes days after a purported video clip showed Ansari making provocative remarks against CM Yogi Adityanath.

16.title: Pant is very exciting as he takes the game on in any situation: Watson
16.article_body: DC assistant coach Shane Watson said captain Rishabh Pant is very exciting to watch as he takes the game on in any situation. "Pant reads the game really well which you can see with the way he has developed his own game, and the progress that he has made. He will always be a good leader," stated Ajit Agarkar.

17.title: Women oppressed in showbiz for a long time, we are like beaten dogs: Eiza
17.article_body: Hollywood actress Eiza Gonzalez Reyna said women have been oppressed in the showbiz industry for a long time, adding that they are similar to beaten dogs. "I don't have to just oblige to the rules that the industry has in a parameter for me," stated Eiza. "I can be a multi-hyphenated personality and do many things," said Eiza.

18.title: Musk denies selling Twitter shares, says 'initial number was incorrect'
18.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has refuted reports claiming he had reduced his stake in Twitter from 9.2% to 9.1%. "No sale took place. Initial share number filed was incorrect," he said in response to a claim that he had sold 371,900 Twitter shares. A filing on Tuesday showed that the Tesla CEO had taken a 9.1% stake in Twitter.

19.title: Development revenue runs out: Pawar on AAP's free electricity scheme
19.article_body: While speaking on the Aam Aadmi Party-led Delhi government's free electricity and water scheme, Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said that people like freebies but political parties must think about long-term development. Pawar further said that development revenue runs out in providing water and electricity for free to people. He also urged the Centre to reduce tax on fuel.

20.title: SpaceX, US govt's USAID deliver 5,000 Starlink teminals to Ukraine
20.article_body: The United States Agency for International Development (USAID) said it has provided 5,000 Starlink satellite internet terminals to Ukraine, in partnership with SpaceX. The agency purchased 1,333 terminals, while SpaceX donated 3,667 terminals and the internet service itself. Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov had asked for SpaceX's help with internet services after Russia's invasion.

21.title: Man wanted in 11 cases arrested after gunfight in UP’s Bulandshahr
21.article_body: A man, wanted in 11 cases, was arrested on Wednesday following a gunfight with police in UP's Bulandshahr, officials said. The accused sustained bullet injury in retaliatory firing by the police and was taken to hospital. His accomplice was also arrested a few hours later, police added. They were allegedly apprehended while trying to rob a businessman.

22.title: Businessman sets 25-yr-old son on fire in broad daylight in B'luru; act caught on CCTV
22.article_body: A businessman in Bengaluru killed his 25-year-old son by setting him on fire in broad daylight after pouring thinner on him. A CCTV footage of the incident shows the victim running on a street in pain after being set ablaze. The accused took the step reported after his son failed to give account details of ₹1.5 crore.

23.title: You've to do remake with respect for original film: Shahid on Jersey
23.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor, speaking about remaking 'Jersey' in Bollywood, said, "You have to make it original...you have to make it yours and you have to do it with a lot of respect for the original film." However, he added keeping all the important things from the original film is difficult. Shahid's film is a remake of the Telugu film 'Jersey'.

24.title: Pic shows leg of dinosaur 'killed on same day' a giant asteroid hit Earth
24.article_body: A preserved leg of a dinosaur thought to have been killed on the day a giant asteroid slammed into Earth, wiping them out, has been found. The limb, complete with skin, was found at the Tanis fossil site in North Dakota, reported BBC. It is widely accepted that a roughly 12 km-wide asteroid hit our planet 66 million years ago.

25.title: Get on the right side of history: Ukraine to Hungary over Russia
25.article_body: Ukraine has accused Hungary of destroying the unity of the European Union over Russia's invasion after Budapest said it was prepared to pay in rubles for Russian gas. "If Hungary...wants to help end...war...[it should] not create additional sources of funding for Russia's military machine. It's never too late to get on the right side of history," Ukraine Foreign Ministry said.

26.title: LSG are looking like the team to beat in IPL 2022: Morne Morkel
26.article_body: Ex-SA pacer Morne Morkel has said LSG are looking like the team to beat in the ongoing IPL season. "It was a fantastic effort from LSG to defend their 170-run target against SRH...they've three fantastic bowlers to bowl at the back end...[Avesh Khan, Andrew Tye and Jason Holder]," stated Morkel. LSG will play their fourth game against DC on Thursday.

27.title: 2,200 Indian Sikh pilgrims given visas to attend Baisakhi: Pakistan
27.article_body: Pakistan has issued visas to 2,200 Sikh pilgrims from India for attending Baisakhi celebrations from April 12 to 21, said the country's embassy. "During their visit to Pakistan, the pilgrims would…go to Panja Sahib, Nankana Sahib and Kartarpur Sahib," it added. It further said that visas have been issued to Sikh pilgrims from other countries as well.

28.title: One kid dies, another suffers injuries after stray dogs attack them in UP
28.article_body: While one kid died, another suffered serious injuries after stray dogs attacked two minors, playing outside their house near the Thakurganj police station area of Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow on Wednesday night. "The matter is being investigated and such stray dogs are being identified from the places wherever they are," the Municipal Commissioner said, addressing the issue of catching stray dogs.

29.title: India at par with world in disaster management: Amit Shah
29.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said India has increased its stature in disaster management. Now its capacity is at par with many other countries in the world and ahead of them on various occasions, Shah added. "We have travelled a long way in disaster management...Now we are able to get information much before any disaster," Shah stated.

30.title: 3 gangsters arrested for lifting ATM containing ₹34 lakh in Delhi
30.article_body: Three members of a Mewat-based gang were arrested for allegedly lifting ATMs in Delhi-NCR and lifting an ATM containing ₹34 lakh from Delhi's Badarpur, police said on Thursday. An ATM of a nationalised bank containing ₹34 lakh was found removed in Badarpur on March 31, police said. The suspects were identified with the help of CCTV footage, police added.

31.title: Pune man loses ₹17 lakh of deceased father's savings in search of job
31.article_body: A 27-year-old man in Pune was allegedly cheated of ₹17.38 lakh by cyber fraudsters on pretext of employment in escort services, police said. According to FIR, the victim had applied for the job online and was asked to make multiple money transfers on account of 'license fees', etc. The lost amount came from savings of victim's deceased father, police added.

32.title: 15-yr-old French tennis player slaps opponent after losing match; video viral
32.article_body: A video of 15-year-old French tennis player Michael Kouame slapping his Ghanian opponent Raphael Nii Ankrah after losing a match has gone viral. The incident took place during an ITF Juniors tournament in Accra, Ghana. Kouame later apologised for his actions and said, "During the match, I was verbally abused by the crowd, including insults to my mother in particular."

33.title: Edtech unicorn Unacademy lays off 1,000 employees: Report
33.article_body: Bengaluru-based edtech unicorn Unacademy has laid off around 1,000 employees in the past few weeks as part of a cost-cutting exercise, ET reported citing sources. An Unacademy spokesperson said, "A small subset of employee, contractor and educator roles were re-evaluated due to role redundancy and performance." Unacademy was last valued at $3.4 billion in a funding round in August 2021.

34.title: A big thank you to the audience for accepting 'Attack': John Abraham
34.article_body: After the release of his film 'Attack', John Abraham took to Instagram and wrote, "Whatever appreciation we have received...a big THANK YOU to the audience for accepting something...new and different." John added 'Attack' was an "honest" and "humble" experiment to give the film industry something refreshing. "It was challenging through...three pandemic waves but we got what we wanted," he wrote.

35.title: US probes Amazon's handling of staffs' use of sellers' data: WSJ
35.article_body: The US SEC is probing how Amazon handled its staff's disclosures on use of third-party sellers' data allegedly to boost its own private-label business, The Wall Street Journal reported. The emails and communications from several senior Amazon executives have been asked for by the government. Amazon had earlier launched an internal investigation to see whether its employees used sellers' data.

36.title: Why did we elect govt?: SC on PIL seeking to deport Rohingya-Bangladeshi infiltrators
36.article_body: The Supreme Court rejected a plea seeking to "detect, detain and deport illegal Rohingya and Bangladeshi infiltrators from West Bengal within one year" and said that the government is the right authority to examine such issues. "These are political issues...If we have to take up all your PILs, then why did we elect the government?" the CJI said.

37.title: India to face significant consequences: US on India aligning with Russia
37.article_body: White House Director of the National Economic Council, Brian Deese, has said the US has told India that the consequences of a "more explicit strategic alignment" with Russia would be "significant and long-term". "There are certainly areas where we have been disappointed by both China and India's decisions, in the context of the Russian invasion," he added.

38.title: We've destroyed fuel storage facilities in 4 Ukrainian cities: Russia
38.article_body: Russia said its missiles destroyed four fuel storage facilities in the Ukrainian cities of Mykolaiv, Kharkiv, Zaporizhzhia, and Chuhuiv overnight. The fuel facilities were used by Ukraine to supply its troops near the cities of Mykolaiv and Kharkiv and in the eastern Donbas region, the Russian Defence Ministry said. "Operational-tactical aviation also hit 29 military assets of Ukraine," it added.

39.title: English footballer kisses teammate for scoring in injury time, pic goes viral
39.article_body: Wrexham forward Ollie Palmer kissed his teammate Paul Mullin after the latter scored in the injury time of their FA Trophy semi-final match against Stockport. Wrexham shared a picture of the celebration on Instagram, writing, "Sealed with a kiss." Mullin also scored another goal in the injury time to help his team win 2-0.

40.title: Krafton bans 66,233 Battlegrounds Mobile India users for cheating
40.article_body: Battlegrounds Mobile India (BGMI) developer Krafton said it banned 66,233 accounts between March 28 and April 3 for cheating. A list of names of the banned accounts has also been published by Krafton. The company has banned a total of 1,22,766 BGMI accounts since March 6. Unlike before, Krafton now shuts out both the account and the device simultaneously.

41.title: We're getting morning gift in form of fuel price hike: Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury
41.article_body: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury while commenting on the increased fuel prices in the country, said, "Everyday we're getting a morning gift in form of a fuel price hike." Chowdhury further said that the government is citing the Russia-Ukraine crisis as an excuse for price hike. Notably, prices of petrol and diesel were hiked for the 14th time on Wednesday.

42.title: I want to learn to play those one-handed shots from Pant: David Warner
42.article_body: Australia batter David Warner, who's likely to play his first game for DC against LSG, has said he's excited to bat with Rishabh Pant. Warner added, "I want to see how I can learn to play those one-handed shots." He further said, "Ricky Ponting has had a fair bit of success with DC...I am looking forward to working with him."

43.title: Threatened by bulldozer, 5 gang-rape accused surrender in UP
43.article_body: Five out of six men who were accused of gang-raping a minor last month surrendered themselves on Thursday morning after police threatened them with a bulldozer in UP. Ambedkarnagar Police said one accused was arrested on Wednesday but the remaining were absconding. Thereafter, police took a bulldozer to their village and made an announcement, asking them to surrender.

44.title: Raj Congress holds protest against central govt over rising inflation
44.article_body: Rajasthan unit of Congress on Thursday staged a protest in Jaipur against the central government over rising inflation in the country. "People across the country are perturbed by inflation. They are committing suicide due to joblessness and inflation," State Cabinet Minister Pratap Singh Khachariyawas said. The protest came following a constant rise in fuel prices across the country.

45.title: Remember fighting with parents for not letting me watch 'Kuch Kuch..': Srinidhi
45.article_body: Kannada actress Srinidhi Shetty said that she remembers that she fought with her parents for not letting her watch Shah Rukh Khan, Rani Mukerji and Kajol starrer 'Kuch Kuch Hota Hai' because she was young. "I remember watching Hindi movies while travelling...from Mangalore to Mumbai in buses...I always wanted to be on the other side of the screen," she added.

46.title: Govt should consider financial impact while launching welfare schemes: SC
46.article_body: Supreme Court has said that the government should consider the financial impact when coming up with welfare schemes. It referred to the Right to Education Act and added that a right has been created but "where are the schools?". SC was hearing a plea over adequate infrastructure to provide effective legal aid to women abused in matrimonial homes.

47.title: 3 green corridors created in a day in B'luru to transport live organs
47.article_body: In a first, three zero-traffic green corridors were created on a single day to transport vital organs from different hospitals in Bengaluru on Wednesday, authorities from Jeevasarthakathe, the State Organ and Tissue Transplant Organisation, said. Notably, one corridor was created to transport a liver, the second was created to transport a heart and the third one to transport the lungs.

48.title: Glad we don't have to bowl to Babar Azam any more: Aaron Finch
48.article_body: Australia limited-overs captain Aaron Finch said he was glad that his team didn't have to bowl to Babar Azam any more, following the conclusion of Australia's tour of Pakistan. Babar scored 276 runs in three ODIs and 390 runs in the three Test matches. He scored 66 off 46 balls at a strike rate of 143.47 in the only T20I.

49.title: Pic of Tharoor & Supriya Sule chatting during a speech in LS goes viral; sparks memes
49.article_body: Video and picture of Congress MP Shashi Tharoor and NCP MP Supriya Sule chatting during former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah's speech in the Lok Sabha have gone viral on social media. "Shashi Tharoor teaching us that work life balance is important," a twitter user wrote with the picture. "That admiring look," wrote another.

50.title: Superstardom is waking up at 5 am, working through the day: Ram Charan
50.article_body: Actor Ram Charan said superstardom for him is waking up at 5 am, giving the first shot for the day's shooting at 7.30 am and working through the day. "Discipline will make you a good human," added Ram. Ram recently starred in the film 'RRR' with the movie's director SS Rajamouli terming his introduction sequence one of the scariest shots.

51.title: US-based Coinbase plans to more than triple staff strength in India
51.article_body: US-based cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase plans to more than triple its number of employees in India this year to around 1,000, CEO Brian Armstrong said. "We are going to invest for the long term in India,"  Armstrong said at a Coinbase conference in Bengaluru. Coinbase is also allowing customers to use UPI to directly purchase cryptocurrencies on the exchange.

52.title: We condemn Al-Qaeda, K'taka HM's statements on hijab row: Congress
52.article_body: Congress General Secretary Ajay Maken on Thursday said the party condemns the statement of Al-Qaeda on the hijab row. "It's a banned terrorist organisation that has no business commenting on internal affairs of India," Maken said. He added that Congress also condemns the statement by Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra as both he and Al-Qaeda are polarising the country's atmosphere.

53.title: Centre's real strength is its 'weapons of mass distraction': Tharoor on fuel price
53.article_body: Soon after LS passed a Bill on Weapons of Mass Destruction, Congress' Shashi Tharoor said, Centre's real strength is its "weapons of mass distraction". "Aided and abetted by complicit media, pointless controversies over halal, hijab and azaan have driven away focus from price rise," he tweeted. "It's clear that GOI doesn't want to discuss prices at any price!" he said.

54.title: Karnataka CM to inaugurate 'SARAS' fair in Bengaluru tomorrow
54.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai will inaugurate 'Sanjeevini SARAS-2022', a national fair of Self-Help Group women on Friday in Bengaluru, State Minister CN Ashwathnarayan said. About 700 women entrepreneurs from across the country will participate in the fair to showcase their skills and sell the products, which include handlooms, handicrafts, etc. About 310 stalls will be on display at the fair.

55.title: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Kuleba appeals to NATO to send more arms
55.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has urged NATO to provide more weapons to the country amid the ongoing Russian invasion. "We know how to win. But without sustainable and sufficient supplies...these wins will be accompanied by enormous sacrifices," Kuleba added. Ukraine's request comes amid reports of Russia regrouping its troops in eastern regions of Ukraine, after retreating from Kyiv.

56.title: CPI(M) facing most challenging times since formation in 1964: Party report
56.article_body: Communist Party of India (Marxist) is facing its most challenging times since its formation in 1964, CPI(M) organisational report said. "The strong bases of West Bengal and Tripura are under severe attack...there has been an erosion in the party's mass...influence," it added. "CPI(M), as well as Left, have to fight against the consolidated RSS-BJP regime," the report stated.

57.title: Delhi labourer uploads morphed pics of 150 women, blackmails them to have sex
57.article_body: A labourer in Delhi has been arrested for allegedly posting morphed pictures of around 150 women online and blackmailing them to have sex with him, police said. The 30-year-old learned stalking and blackmailing women through YouTube, police added. The man said that he would download women's display pictures on social media and morph their faces with nudes downloaded from internet.

58.title: Sri Lankan Prez appoints expert team to deal with economic crisis
58.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has appointed a team of experts to deal with the ongoing economic crisis in the country. The members reportedly include former Governor of the country's central bank, former World Bank Chief Economist and former Deputy Director of the International Monetary Fund. The members had discussions with the President on key matters, said a government note.

59.title: Can’t be better tribute to Rishi, 2 actors in same role never seen: Satish
59.article_body: Discussing late actor Rishi Kapoor's last film 'Sharmaji Namkeen', actor Satish Kaushik said there can't be a better tribute to Rishi ji. "I remember while giving the last shot of the film, Rishi ji said he couldn't [have] given a better shot," added Satish. "There are two actors...playing the same role. It's...never happened in the history of cinema," stated Satish.

60.title: You are the real Raja Hindustani now, loved all over India: Aamir to Rajamouli
60.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan said that filmmaker SS Rajamouli is the "real Raja Hindustani" as he is now loved all over India. "I am hearing all good things about it and I feel people cannot stop gushing about 'RRR'. Every time someone praises the film, I call Rajamouli ji and I can hear the happiness in his voice," Aamir added.

61.title: Flight services at Bagdogra airport suspended temporarily due to runway damage
61.article_body: Flight operations at Bagdogra International Airport in West Bengal's Siliguri were temporarily suspended from 7 am on Thursday due to damage on the runway. Many passengers were stuck at the airport due to the sudden closure of flight operations. Airlines tweeted requesting their passengers to keep a check on their flight status following the crisis.

62.title: Hyd International Airport to inaugurate 1st phase of expanded terminal soon
62.article_body: The first phase of expansion work at Hyderabad International Airport will be completed soon and the new area will be open to the public. The expansion work was undertaken to cater to the rising demand in air passenger traffic. Now, the airport will be bigger and include the construction of an additional built-up area, GMR Hyderabad International Airport Limited said.

63.title: Turkey halts journalist Khashoggi trial, transfers it to S Arabia
63.article_body: A Turkish court has decided to halt the trial in absentia of 26 Saudi suspects over the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi and transfer it to Saudi Arabia. The move comes despite warnings from human rights groups that turning the case over to the kingdom would lead to a cover-up. Khashoggi was killed inside Saudi consulate in Istanbul in 2018.

64.title: 18-year-old Baby AB's no-look six against KKR goes viral
64.article_body: MI's 18-year-old batter Dewald Brevis, who is known as Baby AB, slammed a no-look six against KKR on his IPL debut on Wednesday. Brevis slammed the six on a 91.1-kmph delivery bowled by KKR spinner Varun Chakaravarthy on the first ball of MI's eighth over. Brevis sent the ball over a distance of 81 metres.

65.title: Delhi's Ambedkar University to hold all UG admissions through CUET
65.article_body: The Ambedkar University Delhi (AUD) will hold its undergraduate admissions for the academic session 2022-23 through the Common University Entrance Test (CUET), Vice-Chancellor Anu Singh Lather said on Thursday. AUD officials said that the students would first need to register on the National Testing Agency (NTA) website and on the AUD website once the CUET scores come out.

66.title: LSG are getting momentum, they are ahead of DC: Kaif
66.article_body: Talking about DC-LSG match, ex-India batter Mohammad Kaif has said KL Rahul-led LSG are "five per cent ahead" of Rishabh Pant-led DC. "LSG are getting momentum...they won [against CSK] because of their batting...[and] their last game [against SRH] due to their bowling," he added. Kaif, however, also said DC know how to make a comeback after a loss.

67.title: RAF jawan arrested for killing his 3-yr-old daughter in Navi Mumbai
67.article_body: A 39-year-old jawan attached to the Rapid Action Force (RAF) has been arrested in Navi Mumbai for allegedly murdering his three-year-old daughter on April 5 by hitting her head and stomach. Police said he had a quarrel with his wife, following which he assaulted her and their daughter. He later dumped the child's body in an open space in Taloja.

68.title: CBI submits Birbhum violence probe report to Calcutta HC
68.article_body: The CBI on Thursday submitted its initial report on the investigation into West Bengal's Birbhum violence to the Calcutta High Court. As many as nine people were killed in the violence following the killing of a TMC leader in the area. According to Indian Express sources, the report says that a large part of the evidence has been destroyed.

69.title: Bollywood lyricist Maya Govind passes away at 82, son reveals she had blood clot in brain
69.article_body: Veteran lyricist Maya Govind passed away on Thursday aged 82 at her residence in Mumbai. "She died in her sleep at home this morning...She had blood clots in...brain and had other health issues like urine infection," her son Ajay stated. Some of her famous works are songs in films like 'Aarop', 'Daman' and 'Main Khiladi Tu Anari', among others.

70.title: Meta working on digital money, employees name it 'Zuck Bucks': Report
70.article_body: Facebook and Instagram's parent company Meta is exploring the potential of digital money and employees are internally calling it "Zuck Bucks", a play on Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg's name, The Financial Times reported. Zuck Bucks is "unlikely" to be a cryptocurrency, the report said. "Instead, Meta is leaning towards introducing in-app tokens centrally controlled by the company," it added.

71.title: Rajya Sabha misses 100% productivity in Budget Session by just 10 minutes
71.article_body: The Rajya Sabha clocked 99.80% productivity during the Budget Session that concluded on Thursday, PTI reported on Thursday quoting officials. It added that the Rajya Sabha missed the 100% landmark just by 10 minutes. This is the Upper House's third-best productive session in the last 14 sessions since the Monsoon Session (243rd Session) of 2017, the Rajya Sabha officials said.

72.title: They have a lot of money, will justify it: Akhtar on MI's losing streak
72.article_body: Reacting to MI losing their third consecutive IPL 2022 match against KKR, ex-KKR pacer Shoaib Akhtar said MI have a lot of money and will do something to justify it. "At some stages, it has appeared that they are out of the tournament altogether, but have gone on to turn things around and win it as well," added Akhtar.

73.title: Mob lynchings happen if we wear skull caps, carry beard: Muslim body
73.article_body: Amid ongoing debate around Azaan and halal meat, Haji Mohammed Salees of Sunni Ulema Council said, "There's a problem if we wear skull caps, carry a beard, or wear a hijab, mob lynchings are happening. They have an eye on what we eat as well." He added Azaan gets completed in 2-3 minutes but there is problem with that too.

74.title: Conman poses as ACB official, asks B'luru engineer to pay ₹1.44 lakh to avoid raid
74.article_body: An unidentified conman allegedly posed as an ACB official and targeted a superintendent engineer of Bangalore Electricity Supply Company and threatened to raid his house. "The conman told Shanthamallappa to apply for leave on a particular day to coordinate with the raid and also gave him an option to transfer ₹1.44 lakh to stop the raid," the police said.

75.title: Will take strong measures if US House Speaker visits Taiwan: China
75.article_body: China has warned that it would take strong measures if US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan. This comes after media reports suggested that Pelosi would visit China-claimed Taiwan next week. The visit would severely impact China-US relations, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Zhao Lijian said, adding that Beijing opposes all forms of official interactions between the US and Taiwan.

76.title: Sleep separately, don't kiss or hug: COVID-hit Shanghai's officials warn residents
76.article_body: Amid a lockdown in China's Shanghai, residents have shared videos on social media showing health workers making public announcements using megaphones. "From tonight, couples should sleep separately, don't kiss, hug is not allowed and eat separately," workers were seen as saying. Another video showed a drone announcing, "Control your soul's desire for freedom. Do not open the window or sing."

77.title: BJP fears defeat in Himachal, wants Anurag Thakur as CM face: Sisodia
77.article_body: Ahead of Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia claimed on Thursday that BJP wants to make Union Minister Anurag Thakur its chief ministerial face. Sisodia alleged that BJP fears defeat in state and is wary of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal's "popularity". CM Jairam Thakur has done nothing for the state's residents, Sisodia added.

78.title: Maha Deputy CM urges Centre to reconsider raising CNG & PNG prices
78.article_body: Centre imposes more tax on natural gas than state government and it should reconsider this, Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said. In Mumbai, CNG and PNG prices increased by ₹7 and ₹5 to settle at ₹67/kg and ₹41/standard m³ respectively on Wednesday. "I do not want to impose more taxes. Rather, [Maharashtra government] reduced tax on gas," Pawar added.

79.title: Sidhu meets family of kabaddi player Dharminder who was shot dead in Patiala
79.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Thursday met the family members of the deceased kabaddi player Dharminder Singh in Patiala. "If the police are unable to arrest the accused within three days then we’ll take necessary action," Sidhu said. Dharminder was shot dead after a clash in front of Punjabi University in Patiala on Tuesday night.

80.title: Congress workers protest against fuel price hike in J&K's Srinagar
80.article_body: Congress workers on Thursday staged a protest against the fuel price hike in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir. "We have organised such protests across the country," a Congress worker said. "They (BJP-led Centre) decreased the prices before polls and increased soon after polls got over. Poor is the worst affected," the Congress worker added.

81.title: You ain't seen nothing yet: Rohit Sharma after MI lose 3 matches in a row
81.article_body: After their third defeat in a row in IPL 2022, MI captain Rohit Sharma took to Instagram to share a picture from the match against KKR and wrote, "We stick together through thick and thin and that's just one of our strengths." He added, "You ain't seen nothing yet." KKR handed MI their third straight defeat on Wednesday.

82.title: Delhi's maximum temperature likely to reach 43°C by weekend
82.article_body: The ongoing heatwave in Delhi is likely to intensify and the maximum temperature may reach 43°C by this weekend, the India Meteorological Department said. The maximum temperature in the city is predicted to reach 40°C on Thursday. The heatwave conditions are predicted from Thursday till April 13.

83.title: Makeup artist identifies dead body by her red & white manicure in Ukraine; pic surfaces
83.article_body: A makeup artist recognised the dead body of a woman she knew with the help of her manicure in Ukraine's Bucha. A picture, which is being widely circulated, showed her dirt-covered hand with red and white polish on her nails. Bodies of several people were seen lying on streets of Bucha after the town was recaptured by Ukrainian troops.

84.title: Google Play to block downloads for outdated apps starting Nov 1
84.article_body: Google Play will hide outdated apps and block their installation starting November 1. Google said apps that don't target an Android API within two years of the latest major Android release version will no longer be able to be discovered or installed by new users whose devices run Android OS versions that are higher than the apps' target API level.

85.title: Mumbai Police's ban on construction at night put on hold till May 31
85.article_body: The Mumbai Police has been asked to put its order, banning construction after 10 pm on hold till May 31. At a review meeting with CM Uddhav Thackeray, BMC chief Iqbal Singh Chahal requested the state government to put such restrictions on hold as it was affecting the disposal of debris from the sites ahead of the monsoon season.

86.title: Omar Abdullah questioned by ED in J&K Bank scam case
86.article_body: ED on Thursday questioned former J&K CM Omar Abdullah in connection with the J&K money laundering case in Delhi. Criticising the move, his party JKNC said, "Even though this exercise is political in nature he will cooperate as there is no wrongdoing on his part." It added that Abdullah didn't seek a postponement despite this being the month of Ramzan.

87.title: Vital to go through pain, humiliation: Rajamouli on 'RRR' action scenes
87.article_body: Discussing the creation of action sequences in his movie 'RRR', director SS Rajamouli said it is important to go through the emotions of pain and humiliation if you want to attract the heart of the audience. "SS Rajamouli is the biggest filmmaker that India has probably ever seen. This maverick filmmaker cannot be real," Karan Johar had earlier stated.

88.title: Being a foodie is my roadblock, I gain 5-10 kgs in a month but I don't cry: Aly
88.article_body: Actor Aly Goni said that him being a foodie acts like a roadblock for him. "My body is...such that I can gain 5-10 kgs in a month...but I don't sit and cry about it...instead...I work on it," the actor said. He added, "I know when I need to lose weight...I don't let anything come in the way."

89.title: There were times I didn't feel protected: Alicia on filming sex scenes
89.article_body: Talking about filming sex scenes, Oscar-winning actress Alicia Vikander said she has been in situations that were not fine, adding that she didn't feel protected. "[There was an instance where] everyone was busy doing their own thing and...[I was sitting] naked for a couple of hours," added Alicia. "It's the worst thing ever to do those scenes," stated Alicia.

90.title: Faf du Plessis has got the respect of everyone in RCB: Maxwell
90.article_body: RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell, who's likely to be available for their next game, has said captain Faf du Plessis has got the respect of everyone in the franchise. "Not only does he lead by example...but he also performs really well," stated Maxwell. "What I've been really excited about has been one of the old fellows, Dinesh Karthik," he further said.

91.title: Mother can't be denied child's custody if she doesn't fit the mould: HC
91.article_body: A mother cannot be denied her child's custody if she does not fit the mould, Chhattisgarh HC said. HC set aside a family court's order granting custody of a child to the father. A certificate by society's few members with an "ostrich mindset" should not be allowed to decide a woman's character, the HC ruled.

92.title: UP govt hands over Ayodhya airport land to Airports Authority of India
92.article_body: The Civil Aviation Department of Uttar Pradesh transferred the land purchased for construction of Maryada Purushottam Shri Ram International Airport at Ayodhya to the Airports Authority of India (AAI) today. The state government purchased 317.855 acres of land for the construction of an international airport at Ayodhya. The land was given on lease in presence of UP CM Yogi Adityanath.

93.title: Ex-Amnesty chief seeks ₹3.8 lakh from CBI officer after being denied US flight
93.article_body: A day after former Amnesty India chief Aakar Patel was stopped from flying to US, he demanded that the CBI investigating officer who issued a lookout circular against him must compensate for his flight tickets. "The officer must pay ₹3.8 lakh from his salary," Patel's lawyer told a Delhi court, asking for "a suitable reply" to the law enforcement agencies.

94.title: Enrolment in govt schools rose 'significantly' post pandemic: Mizoram Min
94.article_body: Student enrolment in Mizoram government schools increased 'significantly' post the COVID-19 pandemic, state Education Minister Lalchhandama Ralte said. "State government has taken several steps to improve the education system and recruit more teachers," he said, adding, it prompted more parents to send their children to government schools. Notably, schools reopened in Mizoram on Tuesday.

95.title: Pre-term baby overcomes cardiac issues, brain haemorrhage at Delhi hospital
95.article_body: A pre-term baby weighing 704 grams overcame multiple infections, cardiac issues and brain haemorrhage at Fortis Hospital in Delhi's Vasant Kunj. The baby underwent 12 blood transfusions and was under intricate treatment and care for 115 days before getting discharged. A woman had given birth to twins through in-vitro fertilization, one of whom died soon after the birth.

96.title: Delhi's peak electricity demand rises to 'highest-ever' level in March
96.article_body: Delhi's peak power demand increased to its highest-ever level of 4,648 megawatts (MW) in March 2022, the Delhi DISCOMs said. Reportedly, Delhi's peak electricity demand in March was 25% more as compared to the corresponding period of 2021. According to IMD data, India recorded its warmest March in 122 years, while Delhi's highest maximum temperature in March was 39.6°C.

97.title: Women in Ukraine cutting off hair to be 'less attractive' to Russian troops to avoid rape
97.article_body: Ukrainian women are cutting off their hair in an attempt to stop Russian troops from raping them, according to a town's deputy mayor. "Girls started cutting their hair short to be less attractive, so no one looks at them anymore," said Maryna Beschastna, ITV reported. "In one village, two sisters were raped...girls of 15 and 16...children," she stated.

98.title: Give me Babar, Virat and 9 pieces of wood, I'll win you WC: Ex-Pak captain Latif
98.article_body: Praising Virat Kohli and Babar Azam, former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif said, "Give me Babar, Virat and nine pieces of wood, I will win you the World Cup." Latif referenced former Manchester United manager Sir Alex Ferguson, who had once said, "Give me 10 pieces of wood and Zinedine Zidane and I'll win the Champions League."

99.title: Krunal Pandya is like my brother and brothers do fight: Deepak Hooda on their spat
99.article_body: Referring to his spat with Krunal Pandya which led to him leaving Baroda team last year, Deepak Hooda said that Krunal, who's his LSG teammate now, is like his brother. "Brothers do fight. We're playing with one aim, which is to win games for LSG," he said. Earlier, their picture went viral, which showed them hugging while celebrating a wicket.

100.title: Got to get out before I slap someone, jokes Jim Carrey on retirement
100.article_body: Actor-comedian Jim Carrey, who will retire from acting after 'Sonic the Hedgehog 2', jokingly said he wants to get out before he slaps someone, in an apparent reference to Will Smith slapping Chris Rock. Smith slapped Chris at the 2022 Oscars, with Carrey saying he would have sued Smith for $200 million. Smith has resigned from the Oscars Academy.

101.title: 161 died due to accidents during hazardous cleaning of sewers in 3 yrs: Govt
101.article_body: The Centre told the Parliament that 161 people died in accidents while undertaking hazardous cleaning of septic tanks and sewers in the last three years. However, there was no report of deaths due to manual scavenging, Social Justice Minister Virendra Kumar stated. He added that 118 such deaths were reported in 2019, 19 in 2020 and 24 in 2021.

102.title: PMPML to launch electric-cab facility with affordable rates in Pune
102.article_body: The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Ltd (PMPML) has said that it is planning to launch an electric-cab service in the city. "There is...a need to provide service to passengers for last-mile connectivity...PMPML plans to overcome this gap through e-car service," PMPML Chairman and Managing Director Laxminarayan Mishra said. The service would be provided at affordable rates, he added.

103.title: World's 'skinniest' skyscraper opens in US with apartments starting from ₹59 crore
103.article_body: 'Steinway Tower', which developers claim is "the most slender skyscraper in the world", is now welcoming its first residents. The 1,428 ft tower, with a width to height ratio of 1:24, includes 60 apartments spanning 84 floors. The apartments range from $7.75 million (around ₹59 crore) for a studio apartment to $66 million (over ₹500 crore) for a penthouse.

104.title: UFOs had sexual encounters with humans, left woman pregnant: Secret US govt docs
104.article_body: UFOs had sexual encounters with humans and even left one woman pregnant, according to US Defence Department documents obtained by The Sun from Defence Intelligence Agency as part of a Freedom of Information request. The report – titled Anomalous Acute And Subacute Field Effects on Human and Biological Tissues – investigates injuries to "human observers by anomalous advanced aerospace systems".

105.title: Rare ancient cemetery of flying reptiles found in Chile: Scientists
105.article_body: Scientists claim to have unearthed a rare cemetery of ancient flying reptiles that roamed the Atacama desert in Chile more than 100 million years ago. The well-preserved remains belong to pterosaurs that had a long wingspan. "Most pterosaur bones that are found are...broken...We were able to recover preserved three-dimensional bones," Chile Museum of National History's David Rubilar said.

106.title: Gold worth over ₹24 lakh seized from man's trouser & underwear at Hyd airport
106.article_body: The Hyderabad Customs has detected and seized 478.520 gram of gold valued at ₹24.820 lakh from a male passenger at the Rajiv Gandhi International Airport. He had concealed the gold inside his trouser and underwear, Customs officials said. The passenger arrived by Emirates flight EK526 from Dubai, they added.

107.title: India our big brother, grateful to PM Modi: Sri Lanka's Jayasuriya amid economic crisis
107.article_body: Former Sri Lankan cricketer Sanath Jayasuriya praised India over its help to Sri Lanka amid economic crisis, saying, "As a neighbour and a big brother of our country, India has always helped us." "We're grateful to the Indian government and PM Modi," he added. India has supplied over 270,000 MT fuel to Sri Lanka to help ease the power crisis.

108.title: Twitter's next board meeting is gonna be lit: Musk on pic of himself smoking joint
108.article_body: Elon Musk on Thursday took to Twitter to share a meme that featured a picture of him smoking a joint during a podcast. The meme read, "Twitter's next board meeting is gonna be lit." Musk, who's the biggest shareholder of Twitter with a 9.1% stake in the company, has been appointed to the company's board.

109.title: 2 men enter Pune girl's house, molest her; burn her hand after resistance
109.article_body: Two men allegedly molested an 18-year-old girl after barging into her house in Pune. Police said that the accused also burned her hand with a hot frying skimmer when she tried to resist them. The men entered the girl's house saying that they wanted a water can kept inside the house. The victim reportedly lodged an FIR on Thursday morning.

110.title: BSF seizes arms, ammunition from Akhnoor International Border in Jammu
110.article_body: In a special operation, the Border Security Force (BSF) of Jammu seized a bag containing arms and ammunition at Akhnoor International Border on Thursday. The consignment was planned to be smuggled into India from Pakistan, BSF said. "BSF...recovered one AK-47 rifle, 20 AK-47 RDS, two rifle magazines, two pistols, 40 pistol RDS, and four pistol magazines," the official statement read.

111.title: Former Haryana Congress leader Nirmal Singh, daughter Chitra join AAP
111.article_body: Former Haryana Congress leader Nirmal Singh Mohra and his daughter Chitra Sarwara on Thursday joined Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) in presence of Arvind Kejriwal. "This will definitely strengthen the party," AAP leader Sushil Gupta tweeted. Singh was a two-time minister in the Haryana government and a four-time MLA from the Naggal Assembly constituency. Notably, Singh had founded Haryana Democratic Front.

112.title: Police open fire, arrest 2 for robbing, sexually abusing man in B'luru
112.article_body: Bengaluru Police on Tuesday shot two men, Mohammed Ashik and Issac, in the leg before arresting them for robbing and sexually abusing a male student last month. On March 26, Ashik and Issac along with two others kidnapped and robbed the student before forcing him to perform oral sex on them. The gang left for Udupi after the alleged crime.

113.title: Bike thief caught in Mumbai's Jogeshwari, 11 two-wheelers recovered
113.article_body: The Meghwadi Police arrested a 30-year-old man and his aide for allegedly stealing 11 bikes and a scooter from different areas of Mumbai and recovered the vehicles. The accused, who is resident of a chawl in Jogeshwari (East), had stolen six Bajaj Pulsar, one Honda Activa, one Honda Shine, one Yamaha R 15 and one Hero Honda, the police said.

114.title: Pollard must get a few more overs to bat with no Pandya brothers in MI: Aakash
114.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said all-rounder Kieron Pollard must get a few more overs to bat with no Pandya brothers in their side this season. In MI's match against KKR, Pollard scored 22* off five balls to help them post the 161-run total. In their previous two games, Pollard had scored 22 off 24 balls and three off six balls.

115.title: Selectors would be worried: Jaffer on Rohit Sharma's 12-ball 3 vs KKR
115.article_body: Reacting to MI captain Rohit Sharma scoring 54 runs in three IPL 2022 matches having been dismissed for 3 runs off 12 balls against KKR, ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said the selectors would be worried about his form. "The rhythm is missing," added Jaffer. "This is a really weak MI bowling attack in spite of Jasprit Bumrah," stated Jaffer.

116.title: COVID-19 increases risk of blood clots for up to 6 months: Study
116.article_body: COVID-19 can increase the risk of serious blood clots for up to six months after infection, a new Sweden study suggested. Researchers from Umea University tracked the health of over one million people who had tested positive for COVID-19 between February 2020 and May 2021 in Sweden and compared them with more than four million people who didn't test positive.

117.title: Flipkart planning US listing in 2023 at $60-70 bn valuation: Report
117.article_body: Flipkart has pushed its IPO valuation target to around $60-70 billion, and is now planning a US listing in 2023 instead of 2022, Reuters reported citing sources. Some sources reportedly said that the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine played a part in Flipkart delaying its plans. Others said Flipkart's internal plan to boost valuations further caused the delay.

118.title: Minor among 2 arrested for stealing 26 vehicles in Ahmedabad
118.article_body: The Ahmedabad Police’s Detection of Crime Branch (DCB) arrested two persons, including a juvenile, for allegedly stealing around 26 autorickshaws and two-wheelers in the city. The accused were held near Naroda Patiya with a stolen autorickshaw. "We recovered 21 autorickshaws and five motorcycles which were stolen from different areas of Ahmedabad," DP Chudasma, ACP, DCB Ahmedabad, said.

119.title: Rana fined 10% of match fee, Bumrah also reprimanded for breaching IPL Code of Conduct
119.article_body: KKR's Nitish Rana has been reprimanded and fined 10% of his match fee for breaching the IPL Code of Conduct during the MI-KKR match on Wednesday. MI's Jasprit Bumrah was also reprimanded but wasn't fined. Both the players admitted to the Level 1 offence of the code, IPL said. However, the IPL press release did not specify the breaches.

120.title: Plate put in ex-India cricketer Contractor's head after bouncer removed after 60 years
120.article_body: The metal plate inserted in ex-India batter Nari Contractor's head through surgery after he suffered a fracture following a bouncer by ex-West Indies pacer Charlie Griffith in 1962 has been removed. "The skin was disintegrating on the plate. So he had lost the skin covering it...hence it was advised by the doctors to get it removed," Contractor's son Hoshedar said.

121.title: 2 killed, 1 injured as cooking gas cylinder explodes in UP's Ballia
121.article_body: At least two people, aged 40 and 20, were killed and one was injured as a cooking gas cylinder exploded in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia, police said. The cylinder caught fire while they were cooking, police added. All the victims used to work at a petrol pump and were living together in rented accommodation, police further said.

122.title: Adani Group becomes 3rd Indian group to cross $200 billion in market value
122.article_body: Billionaire Gautam Adani-led Adani Group has become India's third conglomerate to cross a market capitalisation of $200 billion. On Thursday, the group's market value stood at $201 billion as the shares of five of its seven listed firms hit all-time highs, according to BSE data. Earlier, Tata Group ($320 billion) and Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Group ($237 billion) achieved this milestone.

123.title: Akhilesh, SP sympathise with terrorists: Maurya on Gorakhnath temple attack
123.article_body: A day after Akhilesh Yadav accused BJP of exaggeration in the Gorakhnath temple attack case, UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya said, "Akhilesh Ji and SP have always been linked to terrorists." "I condemn his attempts to boost morale of terrorists," he added. "Our security personnel caught him by risking their lives...his statement is cheap and deplorable," he further said.

124.title: Hrithik and rumoured girlfriend Saba pose with Sussanne and her rumoured boyfriend
124.article_body: A picture of Hrithik Roshan and rumoured girlfriend Saba Azad posing with the actor's ex-wife Sussanne Khan and her rumoured boyfriend Arslan Goni has gone viral. The picture was shared by Sussanne on Instagram along with the caption, "The most precious blessing of life is to be relentlessly surrounded by the best energy."

125.title: Central government must take price rise seriously: Mayawati
125.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party chief Mayawati on Thursday said central government must take the issue of price rise seriously. "People were already reeling under the stress of high inflation, unemployment and poverty when they were hit by...rise in prices of petrol, diesel, cooking gas and other essential items," she tweeted. Notably, fuel prices were hiked for the 14th time on Wednesday.

126.title: New cell discovered in human lungs that may treat respiratory disease
126.article_body: Scientists discovered a new type of cell named respiratory airway secretory cells (RASCs) in human lungs that could help in treating chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). These cells have a regenerative ability that could replenish other cells implicated in COPD, which facilitate normal functioning of alveoli. RASCs are found in tiny airway branches near alveoli air sacs in the lungs.

127.title: Auto driver who knocked down traffic police officer in Chennai held
127.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver, who knocked down a police officer during a vehicle-checking drive in Chennai, was arrested on Wednesday, three days after he went absconding. The driver, Sudharshan, had hit sub-inspector Pon Raj while he was engaged in a vehicle-checking drive on Mount Poonamallee Road. The police have now seized his vehicle and will soon take him into custody.

128.title: 1994 rape victim's son files complaint, DNA test exposes accused 28 yrs later
128.article_body: Police have identified two brothers as accused in 28-year-old rape case in Uttar Pradesh through a DNA test. Brothers had reportedly raped a woman, who was 12 years old then. The woman delivered baby boy but was forced to give him up. She met her son in 2020 who urged her to fight for justice and filed complaint against accused.

129.title: You may be a king, but if soldiers are weak, you'll lose: Kaif on MI's defeats
129.article_body: After MI lost their third straight game in the ongoing IPL season, ex-India batter Mohammad Kaif said, "You may be a big king, but if your soldiers are weak then you will lose the battle." He added, "The skill level of MI bowlers isn't that high this season...the team put together at the auction was not up to the mark."

130.title: I may be raided or booked: Bengaluru ex-police chief after joining AAP
130.article_body: Days after joining the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), former Bengaluru Police Commissioner Bhaskar Rao said that raids may be conducted against him or cases may be registered. Rao added he is "ready to face them". "Our leader Arvind Kejriwal has done many sacrifices...faced many challenges. Whoever treads on the path of reform in society faces many...challenges," he further said.

131.title: Smoking during pregnancy may not cause ADHD in children: Study
131.article_body: A systematic review and meta-analysis of 46 prior studies showed though smoking during pregnancy is associated with offspring attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) it's unlikely to cause it. "Our...review shows...there's no causal effect between maternal prenatal smoking and offspring ADHD diagnosis. However, pregnant women should still...not...smoke," the lead author of the study said.

132.title: News article calls Musk's Twitter stake 'bad news' for free speech, he laughs
132.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk laughed in response to a Washington Post article that said his Twitter stake is "bad news" for free speech. "WaPo always good for a laugh," Musk said. Pointing to Musk's stake, Amazon's Jeff Bezos-owned Washington Post had written, "When you're the world's richest human you can toss billions around like poker chips."

133.title: Heavy rains cause flash floods in Sydney, evacuation ordered
133.article_body: The Australian authorities asked thousands of people to evacuate their homes after torrential rain caused flash floods along the country's east coast. Sydney reportedly received a month's rain overnight leading to waterlogged streets, fallen power lines and uprooted trees. Sharp, short bursts of rain have been creating flash flooding almost every hour, said an emergency services official.

134.title: Delhi Police to integrate its licensing services with DigiLocker
134.article_body: Delhi Police will soon integrate its licensing unit with DigiLocker through National eGovernance Division (NeGD) in order to provide improved services to citizens. "The law enforcement agencies too will have an authentic source to verify such licenses," said OP Mishra, Joint Commissioner of Police (licensing). DCP Rakesh Asthana has also given his in-principle approval for the proposal, he added.

135.title: Constable, his brother shoot father, son dead over monetary dispute in UP
135.article_body: A constable and his brother allegedly held hostage, tortured and shot dead a 45-year-old man and his 20-year-old son over a monetary dispute in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli, police said. The man had taken money from the constable on the pretext of providing a job, police added. Their bodies were later found in a tube well, police further said.

136.title: US sanctions on banks blow to ordinary citizens: Russia
136.article_body: US sanctions against Sberbank and Alfabank banks are a "direct blow to the Russian population [and] ordinary citizens", TASS news agency cited Russia's US Ambassador Anatoly Antonov as saying. Sberbank holds a third of Russia's total banking assets, while Alfabank is the fourth largest financial institution in the country. The sanctions were imposed in response to Moscow's invasion of Ukraine.

137.title: Meta cancels F8 developer event as it focuses on building metaverse
137.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta has cancelled its annual developer conference 'F8' this year. "We are taking a brief break...while we gear up on new initiatives that are all tailored towards the next chapter of the internet...building the metaverse," the firm said. Meta added that it will still be holding its inaugural Conversations conference on May 19.

138.title: Ab nani yaad aayegi: Ashneer to BharatPe's CEO, Chairman on 'degrowth' quarter
138.article_body: Ashneer Grover, who recently quit from BharatPe, tweeted, "So I...heard BharatPe closed its first quarter of 'degrowth'...under able (sic) leadership of Rajnish Kumar (board Chairman) and Suhail Sameer (CEO)." "Ab nani (grandmother) yaad aayegi," he wrote. "Chaabi chheenna and hatti chalana do alag alag skills hai! (Snatching a key and running an elephant are two separate skills)," he added.

139.title: Yo Yo Honey Singh manhandled by 4-5 men at club in Delhi, says one man was armed
139.article_body: A complaint has been filed by singer Yo Yo Honey Singh against a group of four to five unidentified men after he was allegedly manhandled during his performance at a club in Delhi on March 27. Singh said that one of the men was armed. The men started misbehaving and disrupted the show, the complaint read.

140.title: Fox attacks US Congressman; Capitol Hill put on alert
140.article_body: The authorities sounded an alert after US Congressman Ami Bera was attacked by a fox while walking to the Capitol in Washington DC. Bera said he was attacked from behind by what he initially thought was a dog but turned out to be a fox. He fought the animal using his umbrella for about 15 seconds.

141.title: Rohit fans cool down: Virender Sehwag on being criticised over 'vada pav' tweet
141.article_body: After being criticised by Rohit Sharma fans over his tweet following MI's loss against KKR, Virender Sehwag urged them to cool down. "Moonh se nivala cheen liya...sorry vada pav cheen liya," Sehwag had tweeted while praising Pat Cummins for scoring 15-ball 56*. "Vada pav reference is for Mumbai...a city which thrives on vada pav. Rohit fans thanda lo," Sehwag clarified.

142.title: Over 12 maggots removed from man's eye in France; pic surfaces
142.article_body: Doctors in France reported a rare case of tiny sheep bot fly larvae, also known as maggots, infesting the outer surface of a man's eyeball. Doctors removed more than a dozen maggots from outside the eyeball and surrounding tissue, according to the report in The New England Journal of Medicine. Doctors had to pluck the maggots out using forceps.

143.title: Russian women film themselves cutting Chanel bags as brand stops selling to them
143.article_body: Several wealthy Russian women and influencers have been filming themselves cutting their Chanel bags with a pair of scissors after the brand pulled out of Russia and stopped selling to Russians abroad. "I am against Russophobia...If owning Chanel means selling my Motherland, then I don't need Chanel," TV presenter and actress Marina Ermoshkina said, cutting her bag.

144.title: Greater Noida increases land rates up to 25% in residential category
144.article_body: The Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority (GNIDA) has increased the land allotment rates up to 25% which is between ₹5,000-₹7,000 per square metre for residential plots for FY 2022-23. The new rates per square metre of land will be ₹39,000 for category A, ₹36,000 for category B, ₹34,000 for category C and ₹29,000 for category D, the GNIDA said.

145.title: Over 80% kids with autism, cerebral palsy found depressed in Bihar
145.article_body: After check-ups held by Bihar health department organised in collaboration with NGOs, over 80% of the children with autism, cerebral palsy, and other disabilities have been found to be under stress and depression. "Majority of them had been going through mental stress because of confinement caused by...pandemic and lockdown. They need outdoor activities," founder of Special Olympics Bihar, said.

146.title: Rule of law supreme: Owaisi to T'gana govt after GHMC corporator's arrest
146.article_body: AIMIM chief and Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi criticised the ruling Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) and said that rule of law is supreme in Article 13 of the Constitution. This comes after one of his party's GHMC corporators, Mohammed Ghousuddin, was arrested for allegedly obstructing policemen. Owaisi was responding to a Hyderabad Police's tweet about a raid at a pub.

147.title: Intel India revs up growth & hiring to capture global opportunities
147.article_body: Intel is the only semiconductor company with the depth & breadth of intelligent silicon, software & hardware to fuel next-gen innovations. Holding this view, Intel commits to advancing its leadership by attracting the best talent. Intel India is offering competitive benefits like dual bonuses based on performance & profitability, restricted stock units for employees across all levels, and others.

148.title: LSG have too many bowling options, it can give headache to Rahul: Watson
148.article_body: DC's assistant coach Shane Watson has said LSG have too many bowling options and this could be a "big headache" for their captain KL Rahul. "It can be difficult to decide how you're going to give everyone a go...But at the moment, they have all the bases covered," he added. LSG played three all-rounders in their last game against SRH.

149.title: School teacher, her partner sexually assault teenagers in TN; arrested
149.article_body: A 45-year-old government school teacher and her 39-year-old partner have been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting three teenagers, including the woman's son aged 19, near Tamil Nadu's Madurai on Wednesday. "We came to know about it (the assault) after some of the photos and videos they shot were leaked and started circulating in the locality," police said.

150.title: Bitter pill to swallow: Shastri on MI's loss with 4 overs left vs KKR
150.article_body: Reacting to MI's defeat against KKR with four overs left having conceded 162 runs in 16 overs, Ravi Shastri said the loss is a bitter pill to swallow, adding that it was bizarre. "It's like...[being given] a chocolate and before you can say thank you, it's in the other guy's mouth and he's saying thank you," added Shastri.

151.title: Shaw has to improve execution, got out playing pull shot twice: Watson
151.article_body: DC assistant coach Shane Watson said Prithvi Shaw has to improve his execution of shots, adding that he has been dismissed playing the pull shot in both IPL 2022 matches played by the franchise. DC head coach Ricky Ponting had earlier said he will speak to Shaw about his dismissals. Shaw has scored 48 runs in two IPL 2022 matches.

152.title: Saw Baahubali 2 and thought 'Oh my god, how do you up that': Karan on Rajamouli
152.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said that he feels that filmmaker SS Rajamouli "cannot be real". "When I first saw 'Baahubali' I thought I had never seen something like that...Then I saw 'Baahubali 2' and I thought 'Oh my God! How do you up that?'. Then you see 'RRR' and you're like this is too good to be true," Karan added.

153.title: Criminal Procedure Bill violates dignity: P Chidambaram
153.article_body: Congress MP P Chidambaram has termed the Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill, 2022, as "unconstitutional". "It (the Bill) violates liberty, privacy and dignity of people. The Bill was not referred to a select committee," Chidambaram said on Wednesday while speaking in the Rajya Sabha during the second part of the Budget Session of Parliament.

154.title: Gautam Adani becomes world's 6th richest person: Forbes
154.article_body: India's richest man and Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani has become the world's sixth richest person with a net worth of $116.6 billion, as per Forbes' real-time billionaires list. He surpassed Oracle Co-founder Larry Ellison and Google's Founder Sergey Brin and Larry Page to reach the spot. Meanwhile, Reliance Industries' Chairman remained the world's 10th richest person, as per Forbes.

155.title: CAG flags flaws in project to build roads along Indo-Nepal border
155.article_body: A Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) report pointed out several flaws in a project to build over 1,300 km of roads along the Indo-Nepal border. The report, which was tabled in Parliament, highlighted poor design, cost overruns and delays. The home ministry failed to ensure that land acquisition and forest clearances were taken in time, said the report.

156.title: Take care of WB, its debt almost equal to Sri Lanka: BJP to Mamata
156.article_body: Reacting to Mamata Banerjee's "India's financial condition worse than Sri Lanka" remark, BJP's Sukanta Majumdar said, "she should take care of her state as its debt is almost equal to Sri Lanka." "Sri Lanka's total debt was ₹6 lakh crore and Bengal's debt is ₹5.62 lakh crore. Had Bengal been a separate country, its condition would've been worse," Majumdar said.

157.title: No takers for KCR’s third front idea: Telangana BJP chief
157.article_body: Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay has said that CM K Chandrashekar Rao's idea of a third front in national politics will not be accepted by other parties. "There are no takers for KCR's third front idea. He has no credibility among the other parties and nobody believes him," he said. Sanjay added that Rao treats his political adversaries with contempt.

158.title: AK-47 rifle, magazine seized from Agartala bound train in Assam
158.article_body: The Railway Protection Force and Government Railway Police recovered an AK-47 rifle and a magazine from an Agartala bound train in Assam's Hojai district. "When...security personnel asked a man sitting nearby about [a suspicious] bag, he said it is a blanket and...jumped off the train," an official said. Police have checked CCTV footage to trace the man, the official added.

159.title: CNG price hiked by ₹2.5 per kg in Delhi, to now cost ₹69.11 per kg
159.article_body: The Indraprastha Gas Limited (IGL) has hiked the price of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) in Delhi by ₹2.5 per kg from Thursday. CNG will now cost ₹69.11 per kg in the national capital after an increase by over ₹9 in six days. The CNG price in Noida, Greater Noida and Ghaziabad has been hiked to ₹71.67 per kg.

160.title: Kya kar loge: Amitabh Bachchan to trolls on promoting son Abhishek's film 'Dasvi'
160.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan, in an apparent response to people trolling him for promoting his son Abhishek Bachchan's film 'Dasvi', tweeted, "Ji haan huzoor. Mai karta hu: Badhai, Prachar, Manglachar! Kya kar loge? (Yes sir, I do: congratulations, promotions, invocations!!! What will you do?)" Recently, Amitabh had praised the trailer of the film, which released today.

161.title: Ukraine can absolutely win war, Putin has achieved zero objectives: US
161.article_body: The US has said that Ukraine can "absolutely" win the war against Russia.  "And if you look at what they have been able to do just thus far, [Russian President] Vladimir Putin has achieved exactly zero of his strategic objectives inside Ukraine. He didn't take Kyiv...topple the government...[or] remove Ukraine as a nation-state," Pentagon Press Secretary John Kirby said.

162.title: Real Madrid beat Chelsea, Bayern suffer loss in Champions League last-8 1st leg
162.article_body: Real Madrid and Villarreal secured wins in their respective first legs of the Champions League quarterfinals as they defeated Chelsea and Bayern Munich respectively on Wednesday night. Madrid secured a 3-1 win over the defending champions after striker Karim Benzema scored a hat-trick. Arnaut Danjuma scored the only goal in Villarreal's victory over Munich.

163.title: Some people like fighting: Supreme Court on 60 cases between husband and wife in 41 years
163.article_body: Reacting to filing of 60 cases against each other by a husband and wife in 41 years, including 11 years of separation, the Supreme Court said, "Some people like fighting." It added, "They want to always be in court. If they don't see court...they don't get sleep." The court referred the parties for mediation, adding that it's a "time-bound process".

164.title: Need to prepare youth to become job creators, not job seekers: Pradhan
164.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Wednesday said there is a need to prepare the youth of the country to become job creators rather than job seekers. "If students only want to become employees, nothing will happen. This country will become a consuming economy. There is a need to make it an employer economy," Pradhan added.

165.title: Wild elephant attacks bus, breaks its windshield in Kerala; video surfaces
165.article_body: A wild elephant who is reportedly known as 'Padayappa' in Kerala's Munnar attacked a KSRTC bus and broke its windshield glass on Wednesday evening. A video of the incident was shared on Twitter by IAS officer Supriya Sahu. Reports said the bus had 50 passengers onboard and was on its way from Munnar to Udumalpet when incident took place.

166.title: Madras HC upholds TN govt's 7.5% quota to govt school students in medical courses
166.article_body: Madras HC upheld the Tamil Nadu government's decision to give 7.5% reservation to government school students in admission to undergraduate medical courses. "We direct the state to review the quota in five years...steps may be taken to improve the standard of education in government schools so that the reservation may not be further extended beyond five years," the HC said.

167.title: India's first underwater metro tunnel in Kolkata to be ready in 2023
167.article_body: The construction of India's first underwater tunnel in Kolkata under the Hooghly river that will connect Howrah and Kolkata through metro will be made fully functional by 2023. The tunnel corridor is built 33 metres below the riverbed. "Important passage work has...been done...if a technical problem arises...passengers can be taken out through the special passage," the site supervisor said.

168.title: Musk will push Twitter execs to pick up pace: Ex-Tesla board member
168.article_body: Former Tesla board member Steve Westly has advised Twitter executives to put on their track shoes because Tesla CEO Elon Musk is "going to push you to pick up the pace". "Here we are day one...and he's already saying 'Hey, maybe it's time to get that edit function in there.' I think he's going to shake things up," Westly added.

169.title: Reconsider travel to Sri Lanka: US to its citizens amid crisis
169.article_body: Amid the ongoing economic crisis in Sri Lanka, the US has advised its citizens against travelling to the island nation, citing fuel and medicine shortages and COVID-19. The US State Department also warned citizens to "exercise increased caution in Sri Lanka due to terrorism". "Terrorists may attack with little or no warning, targeting tourist places...hotels...and other public areas," it added.

170.title: Pay heed to accused's mental condition: Akhilesh on Gorakhnath temple attack
170.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav accused BJP of exaggerating the Gorakhnath Temple attack case and asked the authorities to pay heed to accused's mental condition while probing the matter. "His (accused) father said he has a psychiatric problem, dealing with bipolar issue, I feel we need to pay heed to that as well...BJP is a party that exaggerates," Yadav said.

171.title: Govt is working tirelessly to augment India’s health infrastructure: PM Modi
171.article_body: On the occasion of World Health Day on Thursday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter and said the government is working tirelessly to augment India's health infrastructure. "The focus is on ensuring good quality and affordable healthcare to our citizens," he added. "Our focus on affordable healthcare has ensured significant savings for the poor and middle class," he said.

172.title: Man from Liberia held at Delhi airport with cocaine worth ₹89.74 crore
172.article_body: A man from Liberia, carrying 5.9 kilograms of cocaine worth ₹89.74 crore, was arrested by customs officials at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport, as per an official statement. As many as eight packets of off-white and white coloured substances, suspected to be narcotics, in his trolley bag were recovered. The accused was travelling to Delhi from Lagos via Doha.

173.title: No one treated me differently: 'Jalsa' actor on shooting with cerebral palsy
173.article_body: Jalsa actor Surya Kasibhatla, who suffers from cerebral palsy said that no one from the team treated him differently. "I was one among them...I was absolutely comfortable while shooting for 'Jalsa'.
