Right from my travel logistics to accommodation, food, local travel, everything was seamless experience...The entire cast and crew made sure I am always comfortable and at ease," he added.

174.title: Who are Russian President Vladimir Putin's daughters facing US sanctions?
174.article_body: The US, which imposed sanctions on Russian President Vladimir Putin's daughters, identified them as Katerina Tikhonova and Maria Vorontsova. Vorontsova, Putin and his then-wife Lyudmila Shkrebneva's elder daughter, is a paediatric endocrinologist, specialising in genetics and dwarfism, The Independent reported. Katerina, their second-born, is an academic and an ex-acrobatic rock 'n' roll dancer.

175.title: Sania Mirza said my son should become a cricketer, but I don't want him to: Sarfaraz
175.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed said several people, including Sania Mirza, suggested that his son Abdullah should become a cricketer, but he doesn't want him to pursue it. He added, "Being a cricketer...I suffered many things that I don't want Abdullah to face. It's human nature. Being a cricketer, I want my brother or son to be selected immediately. Otherwise...it hurts."

176.title: I was going through something in my personal life, was depressed: Uthappa on RCB days
176.article_body: CSK batter Robin Uthappa has revealed that he was completely into depression during his first season with RCB in 2009 as he was going through something in his personal life. He added, "I didn't play well even for one game that season." Uthappa was transferred from MI to RCB after the inaugural season of IPL in 2008.

177.title: Today, it is very hard for me to call him Mahi bhai: Robin Uthappa on MS Dhoni
177.article_body: Talking about his friendship with MS Dhoni, CSK batter Robin Uthappa said, "Today...it's very hard for me to call him Mahi bhai because when I got to know him he was Mahi, MS." Uthappa added, "I played with him after 10+ years. I asked him, 'What should I call you?' He [said], 'Call me...MS or Mahi or however you want'."

178.title: All secular forces need to come together to defeat BJP: Yechury
178.article_body: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury on Wednesday urged all the secular and democratic forces to come together to defeat BJP. "All secular forces should come together to dump the party driven by the Hindutva ideology," Yechury added. "It (BJP) has to be isolated and defeated. It is undermining all the constitutional bodies and selling off PSUs one by one," Yechury stated.

179.title: One person arrested for duping over 250 job aspirants in Lucknow
179.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Special Task Force (STF) on Wednesday arrested one person for allegedly duping over 250 job aspirants in Lucknow. The accused, identified as Prateek Mishra, posed as an IAS/IPS officer and duped job seekers on pretext of providing them jobs in the Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS). The STF recovered fake IPS ID card and appointment letters from the accused.

180.title: Vigilance bureau books 2 Punjab Police officials for taking bribe of over ₹1.5 lakh
180.article_body: Two Punjab Police officials were booked in Ferozepur for allegedly taking over ₹1.5 lakh as a bribe from a man after the audio recording of the incident was submitted to the vigilance bureau. The duo had seized 4 kg of poppy husk from the complainant’s father last year. Later, they threatened the complainant.

181.title: Political messages on answer papers will invite penal action: WB education council
181.article_body: Students who write political messages or drawings on their Class 12 exams answer papers will invite penal action, West Bengal Council of Higher Secondary Education (WBCHSE) said. "Examiners...instructed not to evaluate such answer papers," WBCHSE added. This comes after examiners found that a number of students, appearing for Class 10 exams conducted earlier, wrote 'Khela Hobe' on answer papers.

182.title: India's power grid targeted by suspected Chinese hackers near Ladakh: Report
182.article_body: Suspected China-backed hackers targeted India's power sector in recent months under an apparent cyber-espionage campaign, as per US-based threat intelligence firm Recorded Future. The hackers focused on around seven "load dispatch" centres that disperse electricity in areas near the India-China border in Ladakh, it said. They reportedly compromised an Indian national emergency response system.

183.title: If Venkatesh didn't have Cummins at the other end, KKR would've lost: Jaffer
183.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer has said KKR would've lost to MI had Pat Cummins not smashed the joint-fastest fifty in IPL history. "Venkatesh Iyer was finding it hard to time the ball even though he got fifty. If Iyer didn't have Cummins at the other end, KKR might not have won," he stated. Cummins scored 56* off 15 against MI.

184.title: E-commerce firm JD.com's founder steps down as CEO after 19 yrs
184.article_body: Chinese e-commerce giant JD.com's Founder Richard Liu has stepped down as the CEO of the firm after 19 years. Company president Lei Xu has been appointed as the new CEO. Liu will stay on as chairman of the Beijing-headquartered firm. Xu, who has been at the firm for over 10 years, will also join the board as an executive director.

185.title: Mumbai woman trying to file complaint against auto driver loses ₹1 lakh
185.article_body: A 51-year-old Mumbai woman lost nearly ₹1 lakh while trying to register complaint against an auto driver. The woman was left midway by the auto driver, following which she began looking for the cab aggregator's customer care number and contacted a fraudulent number, police said. However, on pretext of providing a refund, the executive siphoned off money from her account.

186.title: 60% of Delhi traffic police personnel suffer from hypertension: Report
186.article_body: Nearly 60% of the 5,500 traffic police personnel in Delhi suffer from hypertension, according to reports of their medical check-ups conducted in February this year. Further, 20% of them have diabetes while 10% have hearing problems, the reports added. Direct exposure to air and noise pollution, job stress and irregular sleep were cited as reasons for these medical conditions.

187.title: Ex-police officer alleges attack by car recovery agents in Ahmedabad
187.article_body: Retired SP, Narendra K Amin, filed a police complaint in Ahmedabad claiming that he was allegedly attacked by four recovery agents who claimed to be from the crime branch and tried to seize his car. Amin also accused his two former business associates of fraud. He claimed that the car was under Preeti Dalal's name, his former business associate.

188.title: Haryana Education Minister should be sacked: Surjewala on paper leak
188.article_body: After reports that five question papers of the Haryana Board's Class 10 and 12 were leaked, Congress General Secretary Randeep Singh Surjewala demanded the removal of Haryana Education Minister Kanwar Pal. Surjewala criticised the Haryana government, saying that Khattar-Chautala government is responsible for "ruining" the education system in the state and making students dependent on the "copying mafia".

189.title: Married 3 months ago, Guj man killed for objecting to comments on wife
189.article_body: Shabbir Lalpariya from Gujarat, who got married three months ago, was stabbed to death after he got into fight as four men teased his wife. Prime accused Zuber's cousin brother Mohsin passed objectionable comments at Shabbir's wife, after which Shabbir and Mohsin got into argument. Later, Zuber slapped Shabbir in Chandni Bazaar, where Shabbir was also stabbed multiple times.

190.title: Russia must not win the war against Ukraine: German Chancellor
190.article_body: Addressing the lawmakers in the federal Parliament, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Wednesday said, "It has to remain our goal that Russia does not win this war [against Ukraine]." Speaking of the reported war crimes by Russian forces, Scholz said, "The perpetrators and those who commissioned them have to be held accountable."

191.title: We got behind in first 10 overs while batting: MI coach Jayawardena
191.article_body: Talking about their defeat against KKR, MI head coach Mahela Jayawardena said they knew it'll be "hard to work through" the initial overs but they took a little more time to establish themselves as they kept losing wickets. "I thought we built it up nicely...[but then] got behind in first 10 overs," he added. MI were 54/2 after 10 overs.

192.title: Pune witnesses hottest day of year at 40.1°C
192.article_body: Pune on Wednesday witnessed its hottest day of the year at 40.1 degrees Celsius. As per the forecast of the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the city will experience similar hot days ahead this week. Reportedly, the minimum temperatures in Pune have remained between 18 and 26 degrees Celsius, which were significantly above normal for April.

193.title: US man who lived in daughter's dorm convicted of abusing her friends
193.article_body: A 62-year-old US man, Lawrence Ray, was convicted of exploiting his daughter's college friends for years by using threats and violence to make himself rich. Ray met the students when he moved into his daughter's dorm in a New York college after completing a prison stint. Found guilty on 15 counts, the convict faces life in prison.

194.title: Boy kills father over fear of being 'thrown out' if he fails in exams in MP
194.article_body: A 15-year-old boy killed his 46-year-old father with an axe over the fear of being "thrown out" if he fails in Class 10 exams in Madhya Pradesh's Guna, police said. He burnt his fingers so that his fingerprints on the axe don't match, police added. The boy had not prepared for the exams and feared failing, police further said.

195.title: Asked to stop spitting, man assaults 18-yr-old on Thane local
195.article_body: A 33-year-old man allegedly beat up an 18-year-old boy after the teenager asked him to stop spitting from the footboard of Titwala-bound local train in Thane on Tuesday. The man started assaulting the teenager on the moving train for teaching him cleanliness. Later, he got down at next station and beat up the boy again with a stone, police said.

196.title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire reveals 11.4% stake in HP worth $4.2 bn
196.article_body: Billionaire Warren Buffett-led Berkshire Hathaway has disclosed its purchase of nearly 121 million shares of HP, giving it a roughly 11.4% stake worth about $4.2 billion. HP shares jumped nearly 10% to $38.38 in after-hours trading after Berkshire disclosed the stake in SEC filings. In March, Berkshire agreed to buy insurance company Alleghany for $11.6 billion in cash.

197.title: After Delhi, Punjab, it’s Himachal’s turn to see a revolution: Kejriwal
197.article_body: After Delhi and Punjab, it’s Himachal Pradesh’s turn to bring in a revolution, AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal said on Wednesday. Kejriwal and Punjab CM  Bhagwant Mann led a roadshow in Himachal’s Mandi ahead of state Assembly polls. "We don't know how to do politics but we certainly know how to build schools and hospitals and eradicate corruption," Kejriwal added.

198.title: Simon Doull clarifies his 'social media star' statement on RR's Riyan Parag
198.article_body: Commentator Simon Doull clarified after a Twitter user criticised him for saying, "I know [RR all-rounder] Riyan Parag is a social media star...but that doesn't count in a match." "Social media says...he's popular...but that doesn't count when he's in...middle...Runs and strike rate is his currency and IMO it's not good enough. Maybe it's lost in translation a little...sorry," Doull wrote.

199.title: Won't fill petrol for less than ₹50: Maharashtra petrol pump's notice amid rising prices
199.article_body: A petrol pump in Maharashtra's Nagpur has refused to sell petrol for less than ₹50 amid rising prices. "It's not viable to operate machines for giving such...small quantity of petrol as they consume high electricity. We took this decision to avoid...scuffle," the petrol pump owner said. "When drivers ask for petrol worth ₹20-₹30...machine hits the amount within seconds," he added.

200.title: Ensured to not go overboard, Madhuri can't look vulgar: Indra on 'Dhak Dhak..'
200.article_body: 'Beta' director Indra Kumar said that the team ensured that they do not go overboard with the song 'Dhak Dhak Karne Laga'. "The idea [was] it should not be vulgar...And we succeeded. Families  watched it together....We ensured that we should not go overboard. Madhuri [Dixit] anyway is so graceful. She can't ever look vulgar, " Indra added.

201.title: 33-year-old man held with mephedrone worth ₹27.2 lakh in Pune
201.article_body:
Police have arrested a 33-year-old man with at least 272 grams of mephedrone worth ₹27.2 lakh in Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad. The accused, Nadim Inayat Patel, was reportedly intercepted by police at Sudhavadi in Maval on Tuesday at 11:15 pm, following a tip-off. Along with the contraband, police 
also seized a four-wheeler vehicle and two cell phones from the accused.

202.title: India sends 270,000 MT of petrol, diesel to Sri Lanka amid its economic crisis
202.article_body: India has supplied more than 270,000 MT of petrol and diesel to Sri Lanka so far under a credit line to help ease the power crisis amid the country's worst economic crisis in decades. "One consignment each of 36,000 MT petrol and 40,000 MT diesel was delivered to SriLanka in the last 24 hours," India High Commission in Colombo tweeted.

203.title: Man who bought NFT of world's first-ever tweet for $2.9 mn is reselling it for $48 mn
203.article_body: A non-fungible token (NFT) of the world's first-ever tweet is being resold for $48 million. The tweet, which read "just setting up my twttr", was sent by Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey in 2006. Malaysia-based Sina Estavi, CEO of blockchain service Bridge Oracle purchased the NFT for $2.9 million in March 2021. Estavi said he'd donate 50% of proceeds to charity.

204.title: AAP Youth Wing leader arrested for assaulting policemen in Gujarat
204.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) Youth Wing leader Yuvrajsinh Jadeja was arrested for allegedly assaulting policemen and dragging a constable on his car's bonnet in Gujarat's Gandhinagar, police said. "We had detained 55 Vidyasahayak recruitment protesters ...Jadeja had followed them...assaulted policemen present over there," police added. "BJP government framed him in a fake case," Gujarat AAP chief said.

205.title: Extraordinary! I couldn't believe the way Cummins was hitting: Shreyas
205.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said he couldn't believe the way pacer Pat Cummins was hitting the ball during their match against MI, which they won by five wickets. "Extraordinary!...because in the nets, he was getting bowled now and then," added Shreyas. "The plan was for Venkatesh to drop anchor and tell Pat to just swing at everything," he further said.

206.title: Haryana man kills 13-yr-old daughter over suspicion of love affair
206.article_body: A man allegedly strangulated his 13-year-old daughter in Haryana's Sonepat over suspicion of her affair with a man from the same village. "The girl's father claimed...she died after falling from stairs," said Sonepat Sadar SHO Deepti Garg. "The autopsy revealed...there were injury marks on the girl's body and she died due to strangulation. We have arrested the father," she added.

207.title: BEST starts AC bus services between T1, T2 of Mumbai airport
207.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electricity Supply and Transport (BEST) will be running AC bus services between Terminal 1 and Terminal 2 of Mumbai Airport from today. The bus service will be available 24 hours, at a frequency of 20- 30 minutes depending on the air traffic, officials said. The bus charges will be fixed at ₹50 for each trip, inclusive of luggage.

208.title: MNS leaders give 4-day ultimatum to remove loudspeakers from Pune mosques
208.article_body: Days after MNS chief Raj Thackeray demanded removal of loudspeakers from mosques, party leaders have given Pune Police a 4-day ultimatum to remove loudspeakers from city mosques. "We had given an ultimatum to Pune police to remove loudspeakers from mosques...If the police fail to do so, we will play Hanuman Chalisa in front of mosques," MNS leader Hemant Sambhus said.

209.title: Trains running slower than expected, punctuality declined: CAG
209.article_body: The travel time of trains has increased and punctuality declined, said a Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) report tabled in Parliament. "The punctuality of mail/express trains over IR declined from 79% (2012-13) to 69% (2018-19)," said the report. It added that 123 out of 478 superfast trains ran at slower speeds than the specified 55 kmph.

210.title: Suspected Chinese hackers targeted India's power grid to collect data: Report
210.article_body: Suspected China-backed hackers have targeted India's power grids in the recent months under an apparent cyber-espionage campaign, Recorded Future reported. The hackers targeted at least seven "load dispatch" centres responsible for operations for grid control and electricity dispersal. The hacking group, TAG-38, used a malicious software which has previously been associated with China's PLA.

211.title: Pune woman's stalker attacks her neighbour after being rejected, held
211.article_body: A 24-year-old delivery boy in Pune who was stalking a 19-year-old woman attacked her 39-year-old neighbour with a sharp weapon after the woman asked him to leave her alone several times. Police said that the accused and the woman knew each other. The woman's grandmother had called the neighbours for help after accused threatened to harm the woman.

212.title: I thought we had the game till the 15th over: Rohit on defeat vs KKR
212.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma said he thought they had the game till the 15th over of KKR's innings during their match on Wednesday night. "Never expected Cummins to come and play like that...It'll be hard to digest," he added. KKR were 127/5 after 15 overs when Cummins scored 35 runs in the 16th over to chase down MI's 162-run target.

213.title: Ludhiana man suspected to be kidnapper helps 4-yr-old reunite with family
213.article_body: A man, suspected to be the kidnapper of a four-year-old based on CCTV footage, turned out to be a Good Samaritan and helped her reunite with her parents in Ludhiana. The girl went missing after losing her way while playing outside her mother's workplace. The man found her, posted her picture on Facebook and urged netizens to find her parents.

214.title: Citizens group wants Bengaluru’s Cubbon Park declared 'no-honking zone'
214.article_body: A citizen group called Citizens for Citizens (C4C), in collaboration with Mount Carmel College students, launched an awareness campaign at Cubbon Park on Tuesday, urging people to avoid mindless honking. The volunteers requested police to notify the Cubbon Park area as a honking-free/silence zone. The request in this regard has been submitted to Rajender Kataria, Principal Secretary (Transport).

215.title: Mumbai man loses ₹1.86 lakh in sextortion, male escort fraud case
215.article_body: A 30-year-old Mumbai-based man lost ₹1.86 lakh in two cheating cases. He lost ₹60,000 in a sextortion racket in which two females, after befriending him on Facebook, got involved in obscene acts over video calls and later, threatened him of posting the videos online. The victim also lost ₹1.26 lakh in a fake advertisement online which provided male escort jobs.

216.title: KTR inaugurates Wipro manufacturing facility in Hyd's Maheshwaram
216.article_body: Telangana Minister for Municipal Administration and Urban Development KT Rama Rao, along with Minister for Education Sabitha Reddy and Wipro group founder Azim Premji, inaugurated a Wipro manufacturing facility in Hyderabad's Maheshwaram on Tuesday. "Wipro has invested ₹300 crore to set up their facility and is creating direct and indirect employment for about 900 people," KTR tweeted.

217.title: 17-yr-old girl falls off cliff while trying to take selfie in Thane
217.article_body: Police have launched a search for a 17-year-old girl who fell from a cliff in Thane on Wednesday afternoon. The girl, identified as Damini Dinkarrao, had gone to Gorakhgad with her friends on a trek. "While they were coming down...she was clicking selfies from the edge of the mountain and accidentally fell from around 60 feet height," an officer said.

218.title: MakeMyTrip launches Great Summer Travel Sale from 7th-12th April
218.article_body: Aiming to help travellers make the most of the upcoming travel season, MakeMyTrip has launched the Great Summer Travel Sale from 7-12 April with offers like up to 20% off on domestic flights, up to ₹15,000 off on international flights and up to 30% off on domestic and international hotels & homestays. Offers on other travel options are also available.

219.title: Not nominated for award probably because I'm boring; don't drink, smoke: Tijori
219.article_body: Filmmaker Deepak Tijori said it doesn't "hurt him" to not have won an award. "I have not even...been nominated till date...I guess probably because I've not been social animal. I don't drink, I don't smoke. I am boring, vegetarian man!" he added. He further said he played a role in 'Baadshah' as he had a good equation with the director.

220.title: Pat diye chakke: Shah Rukh Khan as Cummins slams joint-fastest IPL fifty to help KKR win
220.article_body: KKR owner Shah Rukh Khan took to Instagram to praise his team following their win against MI. "Wow again...@patcummins30 I want to dance like @ar12russell and hug you like the whole team did," he wrote. "Wow...well done KKR and what else is there to say! 'Pat' diye chakke!" he added. Pat Cummins smashed the joint-fastest IPL fifty off 14 deliveries.

221.title: Rohit says 'Awaaz badhao yaar' in frustration during post-match interview, video viral
221.article_body: A video of MI captain Rohit Sharma saying 'Awaaz badhao yaar uska thoda (Increase his volume)' during post-match interview following their defeat against KKR has gone viral. "This pretty much explains the result," a fan tweeted. "This will be hard to digest how it turned out to be in the last couple of overs," Rohit later said in the interview.

222.title: Amnesty Int’l asks India to revoke travel ban on Aakar Patel
222.article_body: Amnesty International has asked the Indian government to revoke what it called an "arbitrary travel ban" imposed on author Aakar Patel. This comes after Patel, former chief of Amnesty India, was stopped from flying to US at Bengaluru airport. The global human rights body said the action against Patel shows India's "mounting crackdown on human rights defenders and activists".

223.title: MI's Daniel Sams bowls most expensive over of IPL 2022
223.article_body: Mumbai Indians (MI) fast bowler Daniel Sams bowled the most expensive over of IPL 2022 so far against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) after conceding 35 runs in his third over of the match on Wednesday. Sams was hit for four sixes and two fours by Pat Cummins. He also bowled a no-ball, on which Cummins scored two runs.

224.title: Performed 'Khuda..' climax in boarding school, said 'Dad has done it': Abhishek
224.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan said that he used to perform the climax of 'Khuda Gawah' in boarding school. "My friends, who were all foreigners...used to think I am a freak because I used to put on that climax, and perform it...I told them my dad has done it...they were very encouraging but...must have thought 'what is he doing?'," Abhishek added.

225.title: DTC bus catches fire in Delhi's Mahipalpur, shops gutted
225.article_body: A Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) bus caught fire in the Mahipalpur area on Wednesday and a few shops near it were also gutted, officials said. No casualty was reported, officials added. The bus was running past its annual maintenance contract, officials further said. "The bus...plying on Route No. 534/39 was burnt due to smoke from its engine," DTC said.

226.title: Father sells newborn baby for ₹1 lakh in Delhi; held along with 5 others
226.article_body: Delhi Police have recovered a newborn baby after he was kidnapped and arrested six persons, including his father, in connection with the case. Police said, "The [baby's father]...was facing losses in...business and wanted to sell his child to earn money...He was paid around ₹1 lakh." Police said the accused allegedly kidnapped the infant after spiking his mother's food with sedatives.

227.title: BMTC launches digital passes for passengers to travel in B'luru buses
227.article_body: The Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation has launched mobile-based digital passes for bus passengers. People have to buy the BMTC's daily, weekly and monthly passes through the mobile application Tummoc and they've to show it on their mobile phone to the conductor. The digital pass will be generated along with a unique ID, validity and dynamic QR code, an official said.

228.title: First-ever ODI hundred was scored in the second ODI
228.article_body: ODI cricket's first-ever hundred was scored by England's Dennis Amiss in the second ODI against Australia in August 1972, a year after the first-ever ODI. Amiss, born on April 7, 1943, scored the hundred off 130 balls in what was his debut match. He also shared the first-ever ODI hundred partnership, adding 125 runs with Keith Fletcher in the match.

229.title: Present evidence doesn't suggest presence of 'XE' variant: Govt on reports of 1st case
229.article_body: After reports confirmed India's first case of 'XE' variant in Mumbai, government said present evidence doesn't suggest the presence of the new variant. "FastQ files in respect of the sample were analysed in detail by genomic experts of INSACOG who have inferred that the genomic constitution of this variant doesn't correlate with...genomic picture of 'XE' variant," government added.

230.title: Cummins smashes joint-fastest fifty in IPL as KKR hand MI their 3rd straight defeat
230.article_body: KKR's Pat Cummins smashed the joint-fastest fifty in IPL history as KKR handed MI their third straight defeat in IPL 2022. Cummins reached the 50-run mark off 14 deliveries, equalling the record of KL Rahul, who had scored a 14-ball fifty against Delhi Capitals in IPL 2018. KKR chased down the 162-run target in 16 overs.

231.title: Cummins smashes joint-fastest fifty in IPL as KKR hand MI their 3rd straight defeat
231.article_body: KKR's Pat Cummins smashed the joint-fastest fifty in IPL history as KKR handed MI their third straight defeat in IPL 2022. Cummins reached the 50-run mark off 14 deliveries, equalling the record of PBKS captain KL Rahul, who had scored a 14-ball fifty against Delhi Capitals in IPL 2018. KKR chased down the 162-run target in 16 overs.

232.title: NEET exam to be held on July 17, JEE (Main) postponed to June & July
232.article_body: The National Testing Agency (NTA) said on Wednesday that the NEET examination will be held on July 17 while JEE (Main) 2022 examinations have been rescheduled to give students across the nation more time to prepare. The JEE Session 1 examination will be held from June 20-29 while Session 2 examination will be held from July 21-30, the notification read.

233.title: Kourtney Kardashian shares pics from her Las Vegas wedding with Travis Barker
233.article_body: Kourtney Kardashian, taking to Instagram, shared pictures from her wedding with Travis Barker in Las Vegas. "After an epic night and a little tequila, a queen and her handsome king ventured out to the only open chapel with an Elvis and got married (with no license)," Kourtney captioned the post. The duo got married hours after the Grammys 2022 ceremony.

234.title: Le Tissier leaves ambassador role at Southampton after Ukraine tweet
234.article_body: Matt Le Tissier on Wednesday announced he is resigning from his role as ambassador for Southampton after receiving backlash over sharing a conspiracy theory regarding the killings of civilians in Bucha by Russian troops. Le Tissier suggested the media had "lied" about the killings, before deleting the post. Le Tissier had served as an official ambassador for Southampton since 2019.

235.title: We will not be going near there: Liverpool's Klopp on Haaland transfer
235.article_body: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp on Wednesday said he will not try to sign Borussia Dortmund striker Erling Haaland during the summer transfer window. "The figures being mentioned out there are crazy. We have nothing to do with them. No chance," the former Dortmund manager said. The cost to buy the 21-year-old in a multi-year deal could reportedly exceed €300 million.

236.title: India sent over 76,000 MT of fuel to Sri Lanka in last 24 hours
236.article_body: In the last 24 hours, India has sent nearly 76,000 MT of fuel to Sri Lanka, which is seeing a power crisis. "One consignment each of 36,000 MT petrol and 40,000 MT diesel was delivered...in the last 24 hours. Total supply of various types of fuel under Indian assistance...stands at more than 270,000 MT," Indian Embassy in Sri Lanka revealed.

237.title: George Russell optimistic Mercedes can 'overtake' Ferrari, Red Bull
237.article_body: George Russell is optimistic that Mercedes can "overtake" Ferrari and Red Bull to fight for the Formula One world championship this season. "It's a very long season, I think we've all got confidence that if we do things right, there's no reason why we can't close the gap and potentially overtake [Ferrari and Red Bull]," Russell said.

238.title: BJP world's largest party, earned faith of crores of people: BJP leader
238.article_body: Senior BJP leader Murli Manohar Joshi on Wednesday said, "BJP is not just country's but world's largest party. It has earned the faith of crores of people, presented them with a different ideology." He further added, "It should now focus on bringing solutions to problems arising out of present-day needs." BJP celebrated its 42nd Foundation Day on April 6.

239.title: Ancelotti tests negative for COVID-19, will travel for Chelsea match
239.article_body: Real Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti on Wednesday tested negative for COVID-19, meaning he will travel to London ahead of Real Madrid's UEFA Champions League quarter-final first-leg match against Chelsea on Wednesday. Ancelotti tested positive for COVID-19 last week. "He will travel to London this morning to join the first-team camp," Real Madrid said in a statement.

240.title: Wish Travis, Kourtney the best that life has to offer: Ex-wife Shanna
240.article_body: Reacting to the reports of Travis Barker and Kourtney Kardashian's Las Vegas wedding, Travis' ex-wife Shanna Moakler congratulated the couple. "I wish them the best that life has to offer on their journey together," Shanna told People magazine. According to a report by TMZ, Kourtney and Travis' marriage isn't legal as they didn't get a licence for the same.

241.title: Ronald Koeman to replace Louis van Gaal as Dutch boss after World Cup
241.article_body: The Royal Dutch Football Association (KNVB) on Wednesday announced that former Barcelona manager Ronald Koeman will replace Louis van Gaal as manager after the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar. Van Gaal said last week he is receiving treatment for prostate cancer. Koeman's first stint as manager of the national team ended in August 2020 so he could join Barcelona.

242.title: Have urged Putin to declare ceasefire in Ukraine: Hungarian PM Orban
242.article_body: Hungarian PM Viktor Orban said on Wednesday that he had urged Russian President Vladimir Putin to declare immediate ceasefire in Ukraine. Orban added that he offered to host talks between Russia and Ukraine, to which Putin's response was "positive" but came with conditions. Notably, Hungary has refused to supply any ammunition to Ukraine or allow its transit through its territory.

243.title: Moon Knight's character struggles with mental health issues: Curtis
243.article_body: 'Moon Knight' executive producer Grant Curtis said Moon Knight is a "very complex" character and is struggling with mental health issues. "He has...very complex life that he's trying to juggle, but in [many] ways, he's...similar to...Marvel offerings in the past," Curtis stated. "One thing...people don't...grasp is that at the heart of all Marvel movies, there's a character study," he added.

244.title: Identify all illegal immigrants from Myanmar, B'desh: J&K HC to govt
244.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir High Court has directed the Home Secretary of the Union Territory, RK Goyal, to evolve a mechanism for the identification of illegal immigrants from Myanmar and Bangladesh. The Court's order came following a PIL, which gave directions to shift illegal immigrants from J&K, as no refugee camp has been declared in the Union Territory.

245.title: Fire breaks out at Congress' headquarters in New Delhi
245.article_body: A fire broke out at Congress party headquarters in New Delhi's Akbar Road on Wednesday around 7 pm. "There was an electric fault in ACs due to which the fire occurred. It has been doused completely," an official from the Connaught Place Fire Station said. The caretaker and guards had alerted the fire department and police about the incident.

246.title: Was shocked when R Balki approached me for 'Chup...': Dulquer Salmaan
246.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan has said that he was "shocked" when filmmaker R Balki approached him for his upcoming film 'Chup: Revenge of the Artist'. "I was shocked and said, 'Are you really thinking about me for this role?' Because it's something I haven't done before," Dulquer said. The actor further said that the psychological thriller is "an experimental film".

247.title: SRK to begin shooting for Hirani's film around April 15: Report
247.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan will reportedly begin shooting for his upcoming film with director Rajkumar Hirani around April 15. "Hirani has the habit of keeping a gap between two schedules...While Hirani will work on his edit of 40-day work, Shah Rukh, in the meantime, will shoot for Atlee's next," a source stated. The shooting will take place in Mumbai.

248.title: Parliament passes Bill that seeks to collect biometrics of convicts
248.article_body: Parliament passed Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill that seeks to allow investigating agencies to collect physical and biological samples of convicts and persons accused of crimes. Union Minister Amit Shah said, "I want to assure this isn't going to violate anyone's privacy." Political detainees' biometrics won't be collected if they are detained during participation in protest, he added.

249.title: Why is he speaking on our issue?: Muskan's father on Zawahiri's video
249.article_body: After his daughter Muskan was praised by Al-Qaeda chief Ayman Al Zawahiri amid the hijab controversy, Mohammed Hussain said, "I don't even know who he is...We don't need Al-Qaeda to speak about our country's issues." In February, Muskan had defended wearing hijab and chanted 'Allah-hu-Akbar'. Her father said the video disturbed Muskan and she is worried about her education.

250.title: Haryana govt reciting tables of 35 & 80 while hiking fuel rates: Hooda
250.article_body: Former Haryana Chief Minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda on Wednesday said, "It seems as if the government is reading the table of 35 and 80 with petroleum products". He added, "Petrol and diesel in Haryana were cheaper than the neighbouring states under the erstwhile Congress government." Fuel in Haryana is now more expensive than its neighbours after multiple hikes, Hooda added.

251.title: Parliament saw healthy discussion on Ukraine, grateful to MPs: PM
251.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said the Parliament witnessed a healthy discussion on the Ukraine situation and India's repatriation initiative 'Operation Ganga' in the last few days. He thanked MPs for enriching the discussion with their views. "The rich level of debate and constructive points illustrate how there is bipartisanship when it comes to matters of foreign policy," he tweeted.

252.title: What is the 'no-fault divorce' law that has come into force in England?
252.article_body: The 'no-fault divorce' law, which came into force on Wednesday in England, allows unhappy spouses to end their marriages without blaming each other. The onset of no-fault divorces means spouses no longer need to prove each other guilty of adultery, unreasonable behaviour or desertion. While experts expect a rush of divorces, they predict it could also increase rates of marriage.

253.title: China calls for probe into "disturbing" killings in Ukraine's Bucha
253.article_body: Chinese Foreign Ministry Spokesperson Zhao Lijian on Wednesday said that reports and images about the deaths of civilians in Ukraine's Bucha are "deeply disturbing". Lijian said the truth and specific causes of the incident should be verified, adding that blame shouldn't be apportioned before the "truth" is verified. Reportedly, China has refused to criticise Russia for its actions in Ukraine.

254.title: Maruti Suzuki to recall 19,731 EECO cars to rectify wheel size marking
254.article_body: India's largest car manufacturer Maruti Suzuki on Wednesday said it'll voluntarily recall 19,731 units of its EECO model to inspect and rectify incorrect marking of wheel size. The incorrect marking has been found in units manufactured between July 19, 2021 and October 5, 2021. "The issue has no implication on performance, safety or environment," the carmaker said in a statement.

255.title: Only use CUET for UG admissions: UGC directs Central Universities
255.article_body: The University Grants Commission on Wednesday directed the Central Universities to only use Common University Entrance Test (CUET) scores to admit students in undergraduate programmes, except for activity-oriented courses, such as performing arts. Meanwhile, the application process for the CUET 2022 for admission to undergraduate programmes began on Wednesday.

256.title: Being denied basic human needs, aim is to humiliate me: Majithia
256.article_body: SAD leader Bikram Singh Majithia has filed a plea alleging denial of "basic human needs" with the "sole view of humiliating him". He further said he was being subjected to an "insecure atmosphere" and "poor living conditions" at the Patiala Central Jail. Majithia added that he has been moved to a dilapidated cell which is used to punish inmates.

257.title: She's very straight up: Shahid on Mira being critical of his films
257.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor has said that his wife Mira Rajput is "very straight up" while being critical of all his films. However, he added that she doesn't "waste her time" commenting on his bad films. "She's like, 'it's so bad I don't want to comment on it. Let's talk about the ones that are decent'," Shahid further stated.

258.title: It's becoming difficult for Putin to fund Ukrainian war: White House
258.article_body: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki on Tuesday said that it's becoming difficult for Russian President Vladimir Putin to fund the war in Ukraine. Psaki said, "What we're doing and we're already seeing effectively happen is...financial system in Russia is near the brink of collapse." Terming Putin a "war criminal", Psaki added the US is working to hold Russia accountable.

259.title: Greece, Cyprus & Israel to expand their energy cooperation
259.article_body: Greece, Cyprus and Israel will continue to expand their energy cooperation through natural gas pipelines with added focus on reducing Europe's dependency on Russian energy imports, the countries' foreign ministers said on Tuesday. The countries will build an underwater power cable that will link their electricity grids. Another project aimed to supply Europe with natural gas was also approved.

260.title: Govt to celebrate 'Yoga Mahotsav' at Red Fort in Delhi tomorrow
260.article_body: The Ministry of AYUSH will hold a 'Yoga Mahotsav' at the Red Fort in Delhi on World Health Day on April 7 (Thursday). Tomorrow is also the 75th day of the countdown to International Day of Yoga, which is observed on June 21. Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla is likely to be the chief guest at the event.

261.title: Ties with Pakistan are unbreakable: China amid Pak political crisis
261.article_body: Amid Pakistan political crisis, Chinese Foreign Ministry said that its ties with Pakistan are "unbreakable and rock solid". The ministry added Pakistan's internal turmoil won't affect the overall cooperation between the "all-weather allies". Notably, Imran Khan has been de-notified as PM of Pakistan as the President dissolved the National Assembly after it rejected a no-trust move against Khan.

262.title: US imposes sanctions on Russian President Putin's daughters
262.article_body: The US has announced new sanctions on Russian financial institutions and individuals, including Russian President Vladimir Putin's two daughters. The US also announced sanctions on the wife and daughter of Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov. The sanctions aim to increase economic pressure on Russia and Putin himself amid the massacre in Ukraine's Bucha.

263.title: Al-Qaeda will never understand but Indian Muslims will: Assam CM
263.article_body: Responding to Al-Qaeda chief Ayman Mohammed Rabie al-Zawahiri's comment on the ongoing hijab row in India, Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said, "Al-Qaeda will never understand, but Indian Muslims will". The Al-Qaeda chief, in a video released on Tuesday, asked the Muslims to fight the assault on Islam "intellectually, using the media and with weapons on the battlefield."

264.title: West derailing our peace talks with Ukraine, fuelling hysteria: Russia
264.article_body: Kremlin said on Wednesday that peace talks between Moscow and Kyiv weren't progressing rapidly. Russia has also accused the West of fuelling "hysteria" over allegations of war crimes by Russian troops in Ukraine's Bucha in a bid to derail peace talks. Ukraine has urged more sanctions against Russia for civilian killings in Bucha, a charge Russia has termed "monstrous forgery".

265.title: India should be less worried about giving 'gyan' to world: Jaishankar
265.article_body: Minister of External Affairs S Jaishankar on Wednesday said that India should focus on its national interests and be less "concerned" about giving "gyan" to the world. The House passed the bill, which was introduced in the Lok Sabha on April 5, that seeks to "prohibit" financing of "any activity" in relation to weapons of mass destruction.

266.title: IAS officer's tweets on how to be 'smart aspirant' for interview go viral
266.article_body: IAS officer Jitin Yadav's tweets on preparing for UPSC interviews are going viral. "A smart aspirant not only prepares well for interview but also try to know background of UPSC Chairman and Members who will be heading interview boards," he wrote. He also shared information about UPSC Chairman Dr Manoj Soni and other members including, Sujata Mehta and Smita Nagaraj.

267.title: Delighted that Hrithik, Sussanne have found love again: Pooja Bedi
267.article_body: Pooja Bedi has said she's "delighted" that Hrithik Roshan and Sussanne Khan "have found love again". This comes after pictures of Hrithik and his rumoured girlfriend Saba Azad partying with Sussanne and her rumoured boyfriend Arslan Goni were shared by Pooja. Speaking to the Times of India, she said that Sussanne hosted the party to launch a cafe in Goa.

268.title: Cinema is more about stories now, not just box office numbers: Sanjana
268.article_body: Actress Sanjana Sanghi has said that Indian cinema is more about stories now and not just about box office business. "For so long...it had become all about the numbers and the box office business. In that sense, now (when stories are prioritised) is the best time to be a young leading actor in the industry," she stated.

269.title: Sidhant was in trance whole time during 'Operation...' shoot: Bhumika
269.article_body: Actress Bhumika Chawla has said that working with Sidhant Gupta in 'Operation Romeo' was a "brilliant" experience. "Sidhant was in a trance the whole time," she stated. "There's one type where you go to the disco and listen to trance and the other one is where you absorb the entire character...and live it thoroughly, I observed that," she added.

270.title: Display your names in Marathi 1st, then other languages: BMC to shop owners
270.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation of Mumbai on Wednesday ordered shop owners to display the names of their shops first in Marathi in capital letters followed by other languages. It added that the font size of Marathi letters should be bigger than others. "The names of visionary men, forts shouldn't be written on nameplates of liquor shops," the order added.

271.title: Minority killings in J&K was at peak in 2021,11 people killed: MHA
271.article_body: The killing of people belonging to minority communities in Jammu and Kashmir was at its peak in 2021, with 11 deaths, the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) stated in the Rajya Sabha on Wednesday. "The government has taken several measures to ensure the safety of minorities in the valley," said Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai.

272.title: Meta employees 'lovingly' call me 'The Eye of Sauron': Mark Zuckerberg
272.article_body: During an appearance on The Tim Ferriss Show, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg said, "Some of the folks I work with at the company, they say this lovingly, but I think that they sometimes refer to my attention as the Eye of Sauron." Zuckerberg was referring to the Lord of the Rings villain usually depicted as a flaming eye.

273.title: Anil Deshmukh sent to CBI custody till April 11 in extortion case
273.article_body: Former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh was sent to CBI custody till April 11 in connection with an alleged extortion case. The agency took Deshmukh into its custody from Arthur Road jail earlier today and presented him before a court. Seeking his custody for 10 days, CBI claimed he's trying to evade questioning and that's why he's citing health reasons.

274.title: 2,105 migrants returned to Kashmir after repeal of Article 370: Rai
274.article_body: Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai on Wednesday said that about 2,105 migrants have returned to the Kashmir valley after the repeal of Article 370 in Jammu and Kashmir. He said that they returned to take up jobs provided by the Prime Minister's Development Package, adding that 841 appointments were made in 2020-2021, followed by 1,264 in 2021-2022.

275.title: Great white shark kills 2 swimmers as body washes ashore in Durban
275.article_body: Two swimmers have been killed by a great white shark in a series of fatal attacks in Durban, South Africa. The first victim was discovered after his body was found washed up by a walker. South Africa's emergency medical services Netcare 911 said portions of the man's body were missing while multiple shark bites were clearly visible on the body.

276.title: Mushrooms can talk to each other and recognise up to 50 words: Research
276.article_body: Mushrooms can talk to each other and recognise up to 50 words, according to a research. The study of the electrical activity of four species of fungi found electrical impulses were structurally similar to human speech and resembled vocabulary of dozens of words. The research was conducted by professor Andrew Adamatzky from University of the West of England.

277.title: Pope Francis condemns massacre of Bucha, kisses Ukrainian flag
277.article_body: Pope Francis on Wednesday kissed a Ukrainian flag and condemned the massacre of Bucha where bodies tied and shot at close range were scattered on the streets after Russian troops withdrew from the city. "Stop this war! Let the weapons fall silent! Stop sowing death and destruction," he said at the end of his weekly audience at the Vatican.

278.title: MI, KKR announce playing XIs for their IPL 2022 clash, Baby AB makes debut
278.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer won the toss and elected to bowl first against MI. Both the teams have made two changes each to their playing XIs. Pat Cummins and Rasikh Salam replaced Tim Southee and Shivam Mavi for KKR. For MI, Suryakumar Yadav has replaced Anmolpreet Singh and 18-year-old Dewald Brevis, who's nicknamed Baby AB, is making his IPL debut.

279.title: Earth likely to be hit by geomagnetic storm today and tomorrow
279.article_body: Earth is expected to be hit by a geomagnetic storm on Wednesday and Thursday, as per a forecast by Space Weather Prediction Center of National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA). However, it'll be a minor one, NOAA said, categorising it as G1. NOAA said a coronal mass ejection from an approximately 25-degree-long filament lifted off the Sun on March 3.

280.title: US approves sale of air defence system worth $95 million to Taiwan
280.article_body: The US Defence Security Cooperation Agency (DSCA) on Tuesday said the US has approved the potential sale to Taiwan of equipment, training and other items to support the Patriot Air Defence System in a deal worth $95 million. "The proposed sale will help to sustain the recipient's missile density and ensure readiness for air operations," the Pentagon said.

281.title: Ex-Burkina Faso Prez sentenced to life in prison over predecessor's murder
281.article_body: Ex-Burkina Faso President Blaise Compaoré was sentenced to life imprisonment for complicity in 1987 murder of his predecessor Thomas Sankara, a military tribunal ruled on Wednesday. Sankara was gunned down in Ouagadougou, four years after he assumed power. Compaoré, who has been in exile since 2014, was charged along with his former head of security, who received the same sentence.

282.title: AAP MLA visits school as chief guest where his mother works as sweeper in Punjab
282.article_body: AAP's Bhadaur MLA, Labh Singh Ugoke, visited a government school as chief guest where his mother has been working as a sanitation worker for last 25 years. "'Jhadu' is an important part of my life. I'll continue to do my duty at the school," she said. Ugoke, who was a mobile repair shop worker, had defeated ex-CM Charanjit Singh Channi.

283.title: BJP should live up to its Constitution: Tharoor on party's foundation day
283.article_body: Congress' Shashi Tharoor took to Twitter on Wednesday to address the BJP on its 42nd foundation day. Sharing a picture of the first page of BJP's Constitution, he tweeted, "Happy birthday BJP! You turn 42 today. Isn't it time to start living up to your own Constitution?" Tharoor added that BJP doesn't adhere to anything written on the page.

284.title: Cong helping BJP create false narrative of lawlessness in WB: TMC
284.article_body: TMC spokesperson Kunal Ghosh on Wednesday said Congress is helping BJP in creating a "false narrative" about alleged lawlessness in West Bengal and in maligning the state government. On the unnatural death of Congress councillor Tapan Kundu's murder's eyewitness, Ghosh said, "The way TMC and the state police are being blamed for it is unacceptable. We condemn it."

285.title: European Union proposes ban on Russian coal amid new sanctions
285.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen on Wednesday said the EU is set to impose further sanctions on Russia following its invasion of Ukraine including a ban on Russian coal imports. "To take a clear stand is not only crucial for us in Europe but also for the rest of the world," Von der Leyen added.

286.title: Driver dies after ramming car into Russian Embassy in Bucharest
286.article_body: Police on Wednesday said a car crashed into the gate of the Russian Embassy in Bucharest, Romania before bursting into flames and killing the driver. Police said firefighters arrived on the scene and were able to put out the fire. No immediate information has been given on a possible motive of the driver. The embassy said no employees were injured.

287.title: Netherlands prevents 14 Russian yachts from leaving over sanctions
287.article_body: The Dutch government said it is preventing 14 Russian yachts, including 12 under construction, from leaving the country due to sanctions imposed on Russia. The Ministry of Foreign Affairs said in a letter to parliament there are no "superyachts" anchored in any Dutch territories. The letter added that €516 million in assets and €155 million in transactions have been frozen.

288.title: Man arrested for killing woman by breaking coconut on her head in Thane
288.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested for allegedly murdering a 78-year-old woman by breaking a coconut on her head near a temple in Murbad, Thane, where she went to worship on March 23. The accused attacked her as he wanted to rob her. He later dumped the body in a nearby forest and her body was found three days later.

289.title: Peddler, 2 consumers held in Hyd, 840 gms of hash oil seized
289.article_body: Officers of the Hyderabad Narcotics Enforcement Wing, along with Nallakunta Police, seized 840 grams of hash oil and held a drug supplier, peddler and two consumers. The prime accused V Lakshmipathi was addicted to hash oil and sold it to people in Hyderabad through his drug network because his earnings weren't enough to support his expenditures, the report said.

290.title: Russian action in Ukraine's Bucha doesn't look far short of genocide: UK
290.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson on Wednesday said the actions of Russian President Vladimir Putin's forces in the Ukrainian town of Bucha "doesn't look far short of genocide". PM Johnson pledged to impose more sanctions and more penalties on Putin's regime. Mayor of Bucha had said that over 200 people have been buried in a mass grave after Russian troops retreated.

291.title: Hyd Police busts IPL betting racket, seize material worth ₹56 lakh
291.article_body: A Special Operations Team of Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police Commissionerate busted an online IPL betting racket, arrested seven people and seized incriminating property worth ₹56 lakh. According to the report, the officers found ₹31,17,576 in three bank accounts belonging to the main accused and also seized cash worth ₹11,80,00, along with a laptop and nine mobile phones.

292.title: A girl once rejected my proposal, I said 'You have rejected Kohinoor diamond': Dhawan
292.article_body: PBKS opener Shikhar Dhawan, in a video shared by the IPL franchise, said a girl once rejected his proposal. Dhawan added, "She used to play at that time and had a dark face tone. I told her, 'You've rejected the Kohinoor diamond'." The video presenter then jokingly said, "Today, the girl would be crying, tucking her face in her pillow."

293.title: India trying to stabilise economic transactions with Russia: Govt
293.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Wednesday said India is trying to stabilise economic transactions with Russia, a day after India condemned killings of civilians in Ukraine. Jaishankar added that India has chosen the "side of peace" in the Russia-Ukraine war. Russia is India's main supplier of defence hardware but the overall annual trade between the two countries is small.

294.title: No tie-up with BJP in Maharashtra: Sharad Pawar
294.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday said there'll be no tie-up between his party and BJP. Criticising the alleged misuse of central investigative agencies, Pawar said Maharashtra's Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government is strong and stable and will return to power in the next Assembly elections. There'll be no change in the MVA Cabinet from NCP's side, he added.

295.title: ATS group firm goes into insolvency; may affect homebuyers of Gurugram project
295.article_body: Insolvency proceedings have been initiated against ATS group firm Anand Divine Developers after ICICI Prudential Venture filed a petition for non-payment of dues worth ₹25 crore. Over 443 homebuyers of the ATS Triumph project in Gurugram's Sector 104 will likely be impacted. PSP Legal's partner Piyush Singh, who is representing the project's buyers, said homebuyers must file claims immediately.

296.title: Delhi isn't Gotham City: TMC on ban on meat shops during Navratri
296.article_body: Trinamool Congress national spokesperson Saket Gokhale has written a letter to the Municipal Commissioner of South Delhi and demanded an immediate circular announcing that the ban on meat shops during Navratri is illegal. "Delhi isn't Gotham City," Gokhale said, referring to a fictional city in Batman comic books. He added that the Mayor has no executive powers to shut shops.

297.title: India to see 48,000 more EV chargers in next 3-4 years: ICRA
297.article_body: Ratings agency ICRA on Wednesday said India is likely to see around 48,000 additional electric vehicle (EV) chargers at an investment of around ₹14,000 crore over the next 3-4 years. It added that by FY25, electric two-wheeler penetration is expected to be around 13-15%. "India remains a laggard in EV charging infrastructure penetration," ICRA Vice President Shamsher Dewan said.

298.title: Man dies by suicide over debt concerns in Kolkata, informs wife
298.article_body: A man allegedly died by suicide after he jumped from a commercial high-rise building in Kolkata's Park Street area on Tuesday evening, police said. The man, who was reportedly working in the same building, was apparently depressed over debt concerns, a police officer said. He had messaged his wife before taking the step, the officer added.

299.title: Proof that unseen hands were behind hijab issue: Minister as Al-Qaeda praises Muskan
299.article_body: Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said the video statement released by Al-Qaeda chief Ayman Al Zawahiri on the hijab controversy proves involvement of "unseen hands" behind the issue. Zawahiri praised BCom student Muskan for standing in defence of hijab and chanting 'Allah-hu-Akbar' in February. "All these things are being looked into by the police," the minister added.

300.title: TMC leader summoned by CBI over cattle smuggling, goes to hospital
300.article_body: TMC leader Anubrata Mondal, who was summoned by the CBI on Wednesday in connection to a cattle smuggling case, went to a state-run hospital in Kolkata. He told CBI he meant to appear before it but suddenly started suffering from shortness of breath, lightheadedness and cold sweat. He sought to dispense himself for appearing at CBI office for four weeks.

301.title: Excited to work with Charlize Theron in 'Fast & Furious 10': Jason
301.article_body: Actor Jason Momoa, speaking about working in 'Fast & Furious 10', has said, "I get to shoot with some really cool people that I have never [worked with before]." Jason further said that he is "excited" to work with actress Charlize Theron, who portrays Cipher in the film. The actor added that Charlize is "amazing".

302.title: 3 cheat credit card users in Delhi on pretext of increasing limit; held
302.article_body: Three men were arrested in Delhi for allegedly cheating people on the pretext of increasing their credit cards limit, police said on Wednesday. Two laptops, 20 mobile phones, 45 SIM cards and six diaries have been recovered from the accused, the police added. The matter came to light after a victim complained that the accused cheated them of ₹34,425.

303.title: Man in his 30s killed in hit-and-run by a vehicle in Delhi
303.article_body: A man in his 30s was killed after he was hit by a vehicle in Delhi's Wazirabad on Wednesday morning, police said. The vehicle driver ran away from the spot after the accident. Police did not find any document related to the man at the spot and efforts were being made to identify him.

304.title: Pune man cheated of ₹12 lakh by fraudster promising low-cost steel
304.article_body: Pune Police have busted a gang for allegedly defrauding people online through fake online offers of low-cost steel. Two people have been arrested and another accomplice was booked after a businessman was cheated of ₹12.04 lakh by one of them, who promised victim affordable steel, police said. The victim, who made the purchase online, had received a fake GST number.

305.title: Hyd Police conducts special drive to remove tinted glass from vehicles
305.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Wednesday conducted a special drive against the tinted glass, improper number plates and stickers like MLA, Police and Press on vehicles. The police also imposed challans against the violating vehicles. Recently, the city police had reportedly fined Telugu actor Allu Arjun ₹700 for using tinted window shields on his luxury car.

306.title: Hand grenade thrown at worshippers in Afghanistan mosque; 6 injured
306.article_body: At least six people were left injured in a blast that was reported at a mosque in Afghanistan's capital Kabul on Wednesday, an Afghan police spokesperson said. The blast reportedly took place after someone threw a hand grenade at the worshippers during afternoon prayers at the 18th century Pul-e-Khishti mosque. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack so far.

307.title: CCI probes SBI, Axis & IDBI Bank on suspected fee cartel: Reports
307.article_body: Competition Commission of India (CCI) is investigating the trustee units of State Bank of India, Axis Bank and IDBI Bank for suspected collusion of fees, Reuters reported. Last year, Trustees Association of India (TAI) "substantially" increased the fee for assisting companies raising debt, thereby hurting competition, CCI stated in an order. TAI has challenged the probe and called it "illegal".

308.title: India's first case of new COVID-19 variant 'XE' detected in Mumbai
308.article_body: One case of the new COVID-19 variant, XE, has been detected in Mumbai. The variant, a mutation of the BA.1 and BA.2 Omicron strains, was recently traced in UK. The WHO had issued a warning against the 'XE' variant of Omicron, that may be more transmissible than any other COVID-19 strain.

309.title: Female live-in partners' plea seeking protection from family dismissed
309.article_body: The Punjab and Haryana High Court has dismissed the plea of two women in a "live-in relationship" seeking protection of "life and liberty" from their family members. The counsel stated that when the petitioners' relationship came to the knowledge of their family members, they turned against the alliance because they wanted to marry the petitioners with men of their choice.

310.title: J&K teacher beats girl for wearing tilak to school, suspended
310.article_body: A teacher in J&K's Rajouri, Nisar Ahmed, has been suspended after he allegedly hit a girl for wearing a tilak to school. "We received a complaint that a minor girl was thrashed and some objectionable words were used by a teacher against her," Rajouri Police said. Meanwhile, her father said, "If this...continues...we'll all end up breaking each other's heads."

311.title: Ukrainian journalist's 'I'm gonna quit war journalism, f**k it' tweet goes viral
311.article_body: Former Ukrainian Ambassador to Austria Olexander Scherba retweeted a tweet by Ukrainian journalist Illia Ponomarenko that read, "When this war is over, I'm gonna quit war journalism. F**k it." "I'm gonna get a quiet remote place to live and will be writing stories of whales and polar explorers," Ponomarenko wrote in the viral tweet.

312.title: Video shows the moment kabaddi player Dharminder was shot dead near Punjabi University
312.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing the moment kabaddi player Dharminder Singh was shot dead after a clash near Punjabi University in Patiala on Tuesday night. Some people can be seen running on a street after gunshot sounds were heard. Singh was reportedly mediating between rival groups when he was killed.

313.title: Ice cream spoon swallowed by puppy removed from her stomach in Pune
313.article_body: A 12-week-old golden retriever mistakenly swallowed a plastic ice cream spoon in Pune, following which she underwent gastroscopy and the spoon was removed from her stomach. The puppy, Nora, had developed ulcers because of the spoon and had stopped eating food. The procedure, which lasted for 45 minutes, doesn't require any cuts or incisions.

314.title: S Korea to provide more jobs to Sri Lankans amid economic crisis
314.article_body: South Korea has said it will focus on providing more jobs to Sri Lankans amid the latter's economic crisis. The decision was announced after South Korean Coordination Minister Koo Yun-cheol's courtesy call to Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa. Additionally, Yun-cheol, who was on a visit to Sri Lanka, said he would encourage more Korean entrepreneurs to invest in the country.

315.title: Potential for int'l conflict between great powers is increasing: US
315.article_body: US Joint Chiefs of Staff Chairman General Mark Milley has said the potential for significant international conflict between great powers is increasing. He said, "We're...facing two global powers, China and Russia...both who intend to fundamentally change rules based on the global order." Milley, however, added US military stands ready to fight and win any country that seeks to attack it.

316.title: Sharad Pawar meets PM Modi, discusses ED's action against Raut
316.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday met PM Narendra Modi at the latter's office in the Parliament. Reports claimed both politicians talked for nearly 20 minutes. Pawar said he discussed ED's action against Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut with PM Modi. "If a central agency takes a step like this, then they've to take responsibility for it," he added.

317.title: Goa may be mask-free soon: CM Sawant amid a drop in COVID-19 cases
317.article_body: Amid a drop in cases of COVID-19, Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant said on Wednesday that Goa may be a mask-free state soon. The CM further said that the collector will issue a notification in this regard. Notably, four new COVID-19 cases were reported in Goa on Tuesday, while there were 43 active cases of the virus in the state.

318.title: J&K govt received investment proposals worth ₹51,000 cr: Nityanand Rai
318.article_body: Minister of State for Home Nityanand Rai said Jammu and Kashmir government has reported receiving investment proposals worth ₹51,000 crore so far. The figures reportedly indicated proposals received since the abrogation of Article 370 in 2019. He further informed the House about other schemes to boost industrial development in the Union Territory, including those by J&K  and central government.

319.title: 3 including govt officials booked in Thane for allegedly demanding bribe
319.article_body: A case has been registered against three people in Maharashtra's Thane district for allegedly demanding bribe. One of the accused is a retired Sub-Divisional Agricultural Officer whereas the other two are agricultural assistant and agricultural inspector, police said. They had allegedly demanded a sum of over ₹7 lakh from the complainant for the preparation of a detailed project report.

320.title: Don't fear being typecast, playing similar role a good challenge: Mrunal
320.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur who will star in the upcoming movie 'Jersey' featuring Shahid Kapoor said she does not fear being typecast. "I know as an actor what and how I can differentiate the roles I am essaying. I personally think that...playing a similar character can actually pose a good challenge for me," added Mrunal.

321.title: Recite Ram Katha, Hanuman Chalisa: MP Congress to office bearers
321.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Congress has asked its office-bearers in the state to organise events to recite Ram Katha and Hanuman Chalisa at the district level on Ram Navmi and Hanuman Jayanti. Congress' state chief Kamal Nath will also hold a special puja on Hanuman Jayanti in Chhindwara. Ram Navmi is being celebrated on April 10 and Hanuman Jayanti on April 16.

322.title: MI release their anthem song 'MI MI Bol Ke, Khelenge Dil Kholke'
322.article_body: Five-time IPL champions Mumbai Indians (MI) have launched their anthem song 'MI MI Bol Ke, Khelenge Dil Kholke'. "The music video captures the mood of the Mumbai Indians players and the GenZ, of playing the game of life with all your heart, to imagine the impossible and make it a reality...," MI said in a statement.

323.title: Made a deal with parents furious about me pursuing music: Grammy winner Ricky
323.article_body: Indian composer Ricky Kej who recently won his second Grammy said his parents were furious about his desire to become a musician. "I made a deal with them that I would finish my degree in dental surgery and they wouldn't question my life choices," added Ricky. "I finished the...degree and decided to not practise...for a single day," stated Ricky.

324.title: People said 'She is now a film actress, why will she date Rithvik': Asha
324.article_body: Talking about her breakup with Rithvik Dhanjani, actress Asha Negi said she was judged without a thought by people who created their own perspectives, which was sad. Asha made her film debut with the movie 'Ludo' which was released around the time of the breakup. "People said 'She is now a film actress, why will she date Rithvik'," added Asha.

325.title: Fabricated: Raashii Khanna on reports of her criticising South films
325.article_body: Actress Raashii Khanna has denied the reports of her "bad-mouthing" South Indian films. Taking to Twitter, Raashii called the reports doing the rounds on social media "fabricated and misconstrued content" and added, "I request whoever has been doing it to PLEASE STOP." As per the reports, the actress had said that South Indian films objectify women.

326.title: MI's Tilak Varma has shown lot of potential, composure: Shastri
326.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri praised MI batter Tilak Varma, stating that the 19-year-old has shown a lot of potential in his two innings for the franchise. "I'm impressed looking at his wide range of shots...there's variation in his shot selection. This player [can] go ahead," stated Shastri. "Once Suryakumar is back, MI's middle-order will be strong," he further said.

327.title: SC orders resumption of arbitration over ₹24,713-cr Future-Reliance deal
327.article_body: The Supreme Court has ordered Singapore International Arbitration Centre (SIAC) to resume its arbitral proceedings in ₹24,713-crore Future Retail's merger deal with Reliance. Both Future Group and Amazon have consented to the resumption of arbitral proceedings before the SIAC. Earlier, the Delhi High Court had stayed arbitration proceedings between the two parties in January.

328.title: Ed Sheeran wins 'Shape of You' copyright case
328.article_body: Ed Sheeran has won a UK copyright battle over the 2017 song 'Shape of You'. Sheeran and his co-writers, Snow Patrol's John McDaid and producer Steven McCutcheon, had denied allegations that the song copied part of 2015's 'Oh Why' by Sami Switch. The judge concluded that Sheeran "neither deliberately nor subconsciously" copied a phrase from 'Oh Why'.

329.title: Latest rankings for ODI batters out; 2 Indians, 2 Pakistanis in top 4
329.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for ODI batters, with two Indians and two Pakistanis comprising the top four. Pakistan captain Babar Azam leads the rankings with 891 rating points. He is followed by former India captain Virat Kohli (811 rating points) and Pakistan opener Imam-ul-Haq, who jumped seven spots. India captain Rohit Sharma is ranked fourth.

330.title: In which states do India's richest real estate developers live as per Hurun?
330.article_body: According to GROHE Hurun India Real Estate Rich List 2021, Maharashtra is the preferred state for India's richest developers with 37 individuals residing there. Macrotech Developers' Mangal Prabhat Lodha & family are the richest developers in the state. Maharashtra is followed by Delhi (23), Karnataka (20), Telangana (6) and Gujarat (4). DLF's Rajiv Singh is India's richest real estate developer.

331.title: Want people to understand emotions: Divya on her breakup with Varun Sood
331.article_body: Speaking about her breakup with boyfriend Varun Sood, actress Divya Agarwal said, "I am not going to discuss my personal life...People are so used to seeing me 24/7 live...so...that's why they expect so much." "I don't want to hurt their sentiments...I want people to understand...emotions are at a deeper level," she added.

332.title: 'Kashmir Files' will do work of awakening future generation: Gadkari
332.article_body: Union Minister and BJP leader Nitin Gadkari on Tuesday said the Vivek Agnihotri directorial 'The Kashmir Files' will do the work of awakening the future generation. Gadkari said, "Agnihotri did a good job in rightly portraying...plight of Kashmiri Pandits which will do...job of awakening the coming generations." "History is important for the present to create a better future," he added.

333.title: Residents face breathing difficulty after fire at dumping ground in Chandigarh
333.article_body: Residents of Dadu Majra, Sector 38 (West), Sector 25 and Dhanas colony in Chandigarh complained of breathing difficulty, irritation in the throat and eyes and foul smell after thick smoke covered the areas following a massive fire at the Dadu Majra dumping ground. The fire that broke out at 1:30 am on Wednesday could not be doused until 12 hours.

334.title: Allu Arjun fined ₹700 for using tinted glass in Range Rover in Hyd: Reports
334.article_body: Telugu actor Allu Arjun was reportedly stopped at a busy market in Hyderabad and issued a challan for using tinted window shields on his Range Rover SUV. The actor, who recently starred in 'Pushpa: The Rise', paid a fine of ₹700 to police, as per reports. Hyderabad Police have launched a campaign of removing black tinted window shields from vehicles.

335.title: Latest rankings for ODI bowlers out, Shaheen Afridi jumps 8 spots
335.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for ODI bowlers, with Pakistan fast bowler Shaheen Afridi jumping eight spots to be ranked seventh. Jasprit Bumrah, who is ranked sixth, is the only Indian in the top 10. The rankings are led by New Zealand fast bowler Trent Boult, who has accumulated 726 rating points.

336.title: Google Maps to soon show toll prices & traffic lights to Indian users
336.article_body: Google has announced that Google Maps will launch a feature showing estimated toll prices of 2,000 roads in India, US, Japan and Indonesia this month. Users will be able to avoid toll roads by selecting the "avoid tolls" option. Google Maps will also be showing traffic lights and stop signs along users' routes, along with enhanced details like building outlines.

337.title: Even remote areas of Arctic found littered with plastic waste: Research
337.article_body: High concentrations of waste plastics have been found on seafloor, rivers and remote snow-clad areas in the Arctic, scientists said. According to the researchers, large quantities of plastic waste and microplastics are being transported to the continent through oceans, rivers, shipping and air. This plastic may impact the ecosystem directly and exacerbate climate crisis in the Arctic, they added.

338.title: There will be starvation: Sri Lanka Parliament Speaker amid economic crisis
338.article_body: Amid the economic crisis in the country, Sri Lanka Parliament Speaker Mahinda Yapa Abeywardana said, "We are told this is the worst crisis, but I think this is just the beginning." "The food, gas and electricity shortages will get worse. There will be very acute food shortages and starvation," he further said.

339.title: Which countries have the most number of billionaires as per Forbes?
339.article_body: According to Forbes' World's Billionaires 2022 list, the US has the most number of billionaires at 735. This is followed by 539 in China, a drop from 626 last year. India is ranked third with 166 billionaires, followed by 134 in Germany, 83 in Russia, 67 in Hong Kong, 64 in Canada, 62 in Brazil and 52 in Italy.

340.title: My friends wanted to see my posters in Mumbai, forced me to do 'Mayuri': Sudhaa
340.article_body: Dancer and actress Sudhaa Chandran said her friends "forced" her to take up her debut movie 'Mayuri' because they wanted to see her posters all over Andheri and Mumbai. "I always thought the industry was not a safe place for the women...My father wanted me to do it [Mayuri] as it was not just entertainment but inspirational movie," she added.

341.title: Actor Allu Arjun fined for violating traffic rules in Hyderabad: Reports
341.article_body: Actor Allu Arjun reportedly landed in legal trouble for flouting traffic rules. The 'Pushpa' actor was driving his Land Rover Range Rover SUV in Hyderabad when he was stopped by cops for violation of traffic laws. The traffic police noticed Allu Arjun's SUV had tinted window shield and he had to pay a challan of ₹700 for breaking the rule.

342.title: RR pacer Nathan Coulter-Nile ruled out of IPL 2022 due to injury
342.article_body: RR pacer Nathan Coulter-Nile has been ruled out of IPL 2022 due to an injury he suffered during their opening game against SRH, which they won by 61 runs. Nathan had walked off the field after he bowled a no-ball and fell during his follow-through in the final over of SRH's innings. Coulter-Nile was bought by RR for ₹2 crore.

343.title: Canadian authorities recommend 4th COVID vaccine for the elderly
343.article_body: Canada's National Advisory Committee on Immunisation (NACI) has recommended a fourth COVID-19 vaccine dose for vulnerable people including adults over 80 years of age. NACI said that the administrations could also offer the second booster to those aged between 70 and 79. It further suggested the jurisdictions to prepare for rapid deployment of second booster programmes.

344.title: Microplastics found in live human lungs for the first time
344.article_body: Scientists have discovered microplastics in live human lungs for the first time. Researchers from the University of Hull and Hull York Medical School found 39 microplastics in 11 of the 13 lung tissue samples tested. Of the microplastics detected, there were 12 types, which are commonly found in packaging, bottles, clothing, rope/twine, and many manufacturing processes.

345.title: Cong gets eviction notice over bungalow occupied by Sonia's secretary
345.article_body: The Directorate of Estates, which comes under the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs, has sent an eviction notice to Congress regarding the bungalow situated at C-II/109 Chanakyapuri, New Delhi. The property was given to Congress but allegedly its interim chief Sonia Gandhi's secretary Vincent George has been residing there. Notably, the pending rent of the property is ₹3.08 crore.

346.title: ASI provides free IAS, IPS coaching in Ludhiana to underprivileged students
346.article_body: With an aim to help the underprivileged students, Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI), Gurdev Singh, from Ludhiana has been providing free IAS and IPS coaching to the students. Singh started an institute in Ludhiana five years ago for this purpose. "The admission process starts in the month of June...Last time around 500 applications were received," Singh said.

347.title: ADB expects India's FY23 GDP to grow at 7.5%, inflation at 5.8%
347.article_body: Asian Development Bank (ADB) has pegged India's GDP growth projection for FY23 at 7.5%. ADB added that India's economic growth in the coming years will be supported by increased public investment in infrastructure and a pickup in private investment. Inflation in India is likely to increase to 5.8% in FY23 amid rising oil prices, ADB said.
