348.title: Mohanlal just wants to be present and allow magic to happen: Vidya
348.article_body: Vidya Balan said Malayalam film actor Mohanlal will not do anything on set even if he has to spend a lot of time waiting. "Mohanlal told me...I...want to be present...and...when the director calls for action, I want to allow...that magic to happen," added Vidya. "To sum it up it was that the process is bigger than you," stated Vidya.

349.title: Trial in journalist Gauri Lankesh murder case to begin on May 27
349.article_body: The trial in journalist-activist Gauri Lankesh murder case is set to start on May 27, the prosecution lawyer said. "Till now hearing was going on related to bail applications. Now we are happy that the trial is beginning," Lankesh's sister said. Lankesh was shot dead by two bike-borne assailants on September 5, 2017, outside her house in Bengaluru.

350.title: Decentralised system for waste disposal needed in B'luru: BBMP chief
350.article_body: BBMP chief Gaurav Gupta on Tuesday called for decentralised system for waste disposal in Bengaluru. He said, "Almost 6,000 metric tonnes of waste is generated per day in the BBMP limits of which 1,500 tonnes is being generated by bulk generators." He added that bulk waste generators must establish a waste segregation and management unit within their area of residence.

351.title: China robotics plant made staff sleep on cardboard amid lockdown: Report
351.article_body: China-based Siasun Robotics' workers were asked to stay at its Shanghai factory through the city's lockdown to meet delivery deadlines, Business Insider said citing a report. The workers slept on cardboards at the plant. The report quoted Siasun VP saying the firm kept manufacturing to prevent "a cascading effect" of supply chain issues down the line.

352.title: Mumbai woman searches 'wine shops near me', loses ₹4.80 lakh while ordering
352.article_body: A 32-year-old woman from Mumbai allegedly lost ₹4.80 lakh while she was trying to order wine from a local wine shop. The woman searched "wine shops near me". She said she transferred ₹650, after which fraudster asked her to scan a QR code for returning extra money that she had sent. Money got debited when she scanned QR code.

353.title: Maha govt publishes draft rules for wine sale in supermarkets, seeks suggestions
353.article_body: The Maharashtra government has published draft rules for sale of wine in supermarkets and walk-in stores and sought public suggestions and objections on the same till June 29. This comes after the state government received strong objections from opposition parties and social activists. Stores having a minimum of 100 square metres area can only sell wine, the new policy stated.

354.title: AAP ended corruption in just 20 days in Punjab: Kejriwal in Himachal
354.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and his Punjab counterpart Bhagwant Mann held a roadshow in Himachal Pradesh's Mandi on Wednesday ahead of state Assembly polls. Kejriwal said, "We have ended corruption in just 20 days in Punjab since Bhagwant Mann became the chief minister." He added, "Now it is time to uproot corruption from Himachal Pradesh."

355.title: Didn't take Russia's space chief's tweets seriously: NASA astronaut
355.article_body: NASA astronaut Vande Hei in response to Russian space agency chief Dmitry Rogozin's previous comments on US-Russia cooperation in space, said, "I never perceived those tweets as anything to take seriously. I just had too much confidence in our cooperation to date." Vande Hei said that he trusted his Russian colleagues, adding, "We supported each other throughout everything."

356.title: India tops world in terms of people killed in road accidents: Govt
356.article_body: Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari on Wednesday said India tops the world in terms of number of people killed in road accidents. Raising concern over the situation, Gadkari said in terms of number of people injured in road accidents, India holds the third position globally. Fatalities involving road users aged 18-45 stood at 69.80% in 2020, he added.

357.title: I've grown up watching them: Yash on comparisons with Salman, SRK
357.article_body: When asked about his comparison with Salman Khan and Shah Rukh Khan, KGF: Chapter 2 actor Yash said, "I'm a cinema kid. I've grown up watching their films...I'd like to add that...nothing is permanent." "They are superstars and disrespecting them or comparing isn't right. They've...been my inspiration to become an actor. They are the pillars of the industry," he added.

358.title: Mom doesn't say anything if she doesn't like my films: Abhishek on Jaya
358.article_body: When asked about his mother, actress and Samajwadi Party MP Jaya Bachchan's reaction to his film 'Dasvi', actor Abhishek Bachchan said she saw Dasvi along with some of her colleagues from the upper house and the lower house. "If [mom] doesn't like my work, she doesn't say anything. So she said a few words which...[is] a very...good sign," he added.

359.title: Self-enumeration option to be provided for Census: Govt tells Parliament
359.article_body: The option of self-enumeration will be provided in the upcoming Census which will also be India’s first such digital exercise, MoS for Home, Nityanand Rai, told the Parliament. Rai gave the information in response to TRS and Congress members Manne Srinivas Reddy and Komatireddy Venkat Reddy’s question about whether the government will allow self-enumeration.

360.title: Puducherry to host 4-day beach festival to boost tourism
360.article_body: Puducherry will host a four-day beach festival 'I Sea Pondy 2022' from April 13 to April 16 to boost tourism in the Union Territory. The festival will have events like stage shows, water sports activities, volleyball tournament, etc. The festival will be organised across four venues – Gandhi statue beach promenade, Chunnambar water sports complex, Pondy Marina and Paradise beach.

361.title: Myanmar orders foreign money held by banks to be converted to kyats
361.article_body: Myanmar's central bank has ordered that all foreign currency held by banks should be changed to local currency (kyats). In a notification issued on Sunday, locals were asked to convert their foreign currency into kyats within one working day or face legal consequences. Further, foreign currency can only be sent abroad with the government's approval, the notification read.

362.title: Criminal cases against 22 IPS officers in 5 yrs: MHA to Rajya Sabha
362.article_body: Union Minister of State in the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) Nityanand Rai informed Rajya Sabha on Wednesday that criminal cases have been registered against 22 IPS officers under various sections from 2017 to March 30, 2022. One IPS officer has been declared fugitive in Uttar Pradesh as per information provided by the state government, Rai added.

363.title: 2 arrested with 2 kg gold bars in Assam
363.article_body: Police reportedly arrested two smugglers at the National Highway-37 (NH-37) in Assam's Morigaon district on Tuesday. Gold bars weighing two kilograms were seized from their possession, police said. "We received information about two persons coming from Sonitpur to sell gold," said Hemanta Borgohain, the officer of Jagiroad police station. They were caught during a naka checking, he added.

364.title: Iyer is making a serious case for Team India captaincy: Shoaib Akhtar
364.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said KKR captain Shreyas Iyer is making a serious case for Team India captaincy with his leadership in the ongoing IPL season. "He should continue to score runs and lead the team...and I believe he'll become a big brand in the near future," added Akhtar. KKR have won two of their three games so far.

365.title: 3 girls on way to school hit by speeding car in Delhi, 1 killed
365.article_body: An 18-year-old girl student was killed and her two friends were injured after being hit by a speeding car on their way to school on Wednesday morning in Delhi's Paschim Vihar area. After hitting the girls, the car driver then rammed into a truck carrying LPG cylinders and ran away. The two injured girls are out of danger, police said.

366.title: Virat Kohli gives Glenn Maxwell massage in dressing room during RCB's chase, video viral
366.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing Virat Kohli giving massage to Glenn Maxwell in dressing room during RCB's successful run chase against RR in IPL 2022 on Tuesday. "Big innings on the way in next match for Maxwell," a social media user commented. RCB defeated RR by 4 wickets after chasing down 170-run target in 19.1 overs.

367.title: Anand Mahindra shares video showing 360 degree view from the top of Mt Everest
367.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra took to social media to share a video showing 360 degree view from the top of Mt Everest. "Sometimes, when you have to make hard decisions, it helps to imagine you're on top of Everest with an unobstructed view of the world. Becomes easier to see the 'big picture'," he wrote.

368.title: I'll be a helping hand in whatever way I can: Bumrah on MI's bowling
368.article_body: Talking about MI's bowling this season, pacer Jasprit Bumrah, who has picked three wickets in their two games, said he's ready to help if the other bowlers need his help. "If somebody needs my help, I can help in any capacity...I'll be a helping hand," he stated. MI have lost both their first two matches in the season.

369.title: Big crime by Bangladesh to lose wickets against spinners overseas: Haque
369.article_body: Reacting to Bangladesh's defeat by 220 runs in the Durban Test against South Africa, Bangladesh captain Mominul Haque said it was a big crime by his team to lose wickets against spinners on foreign soil. "It is nothing but a total batting failure. We just couldn't handle the pressure," added Haque. "I think it is my fault," stated Haque.

370.title: Mumbai Police uses K3G scene to raise awareness on cyber security
370.article_body: The Mumbai Police on Wednesday shared a video clip from the movie 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham's' scene to raise awareness about cyber security. The video shared on their official Instagram handle features actresses Kajol and Farida Jalal. Sharing the video, they wrote, "Humesha cyber safety, never gham. Third party cookies can leave you vulnerable and should be declined or deleted."

371.title: 22-yr-old man stabbed to death in road rage incident in Bengaluru
371.article_body: A 22-year-old man was stabbed to death by three men in the JJ Nagar area of Bengaluru in a road rage incident on Tuesday, City Police Commissioner Kamal Pant said on Twitter. The incident reportedly took place after the victim's bike collided with another bike, leading to an argument between them. Meanwhile, police have arrested all the three accused persons.

372.title: Who are India's richest real estate developers & what are their net worths?
372.article_body: DLF's Rajiv Singh is India's richest developer with a wealth of ₹61,220 crore, according to GROHE Hurun India Real Estate Rich List 2021. He has overtaken Macrotech Developers' Mangal Prabhat Lodha & family, who now rank 2nd, with ₹52,970 crore wealth. K Raheja's Chandru Raheja & family ranked 3rd with ₹26,290 crore. Embassy Office Parks' Jitendra Virwani ranked 4th.

373.title: Haldiram's trends as video shows reporter questioning staff over 'Urdu' text on packets
373.article_body: Indian multinational sweets, snacks and restaurant company Haldiram's is trending on social media after a video showed a TV reporter questioning the staff of an outlet over alleged Urdu text on namkeen packets. "You can do whatever ma'am, Haldiram's won't entertain such tantrums," an employee was seen telling the reporter. Some social media users suggested the text was in Arabic.

374.title: Mumbai court sentences father to 25 yrs in jail for raping daughter
374.article_body: A special court in Mumbai sentenced a man to 25 years of rigorous imprisonment for raping his 13-year-old daughter repeatedly in their 10X10 room tenement. Noting that he deserves no leniency, the court said, "Father makes his daughter's life safe and protects her." It added, "Failure of the victim to raise shouts...doesn't in any way create doubt in her evidence."

375.title: Pic of US airport kiosk asking 'Are you a terrorist?' goes viral
375.article_body: A picture of a US airport kiosk asking "Are you a terrorist?" has gone viral on social media. Asaad Sam Hanna, a freelance journalist, shared the picture on Twitter with the caption, "Advanced level of security at the US airport." Reacting to the picture, a social media user wrote, "Wait is this really real???"

376.title: Actor Jason Momoa refutes the rumours of dating Kate Beckinsale
376.article_body: Jason Momoa has refuted the rumours of dating Kate Beckinsale. This comes after pictures of Kate wearing Jason's blazer while conversing with him at the Oscars 2022 afterparty had surfaced. Jason said, "Everyone is like, 'Are you dating?' No, no, it was chivalry. The woman was cold." In January, Jason and Lisa Bonet announced they had ended their 16-year relationship.

377.title: Cummins is world's best cricketer, no player has such intensity: Shastri
377.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said Australia Test captain Pat Cummins is the best cricketer in the world, adding that he has not seen similar intensity in any other cricketer. "His 200% is guaranteed," stated Shastri. Talking about the IPL 2022 match between KKR and MI, Shastri said even Jasprit Bumrah knows that MI's bowling attack is not that penetrative.

378.title: Germany carries out nationwide crackdown on neo-Nazi groups
378.article_body: The German police reportedly carried out raids on neo-Nazi groups in 11 states across the country on Wednesday. The authorities searched the residences of as many as 50 suspected right-wing extremists. The groups - "Atomwaffen Division" (AWD), "Combat 18" (C18) and "Knockout 51" (K51) - were reportedly targeted. Four suspects were said to be arrested during the crackdown.

379.title: Hardik told me 'Until you improve, we can't give you a match': Kishan
379.article_body: MI wicketkeeper-batter Ishan Kishan said the franchise's former all-rounder Hardik Pandya told him he won't get a chance to play matches for MI until he improves. Talking about MI captain Rohit Sharma, Kishan stated if Rohit says a batter will hit the ball in a particular area, usually that is what tends to happen. MI will take on KKR today.

380.title: Terrorist incidents in J&K have reduced 45% in 4 years: Govt
380.article_body: Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai said terrorist incidents in Jammu and Kashmir are down 45% from 417 incidents in 2018 to 229 in 2021. He said 87 civilians and 99 security personnel were killed by terrorists in J&K between August 2019 and November 2021. Robust security and intelligence grid are in place to prevent attacks, Rai added.

381.title: Mumbai man sentenced to life imprisonment for killing mother in 2015
381.article_body: A sessions court in Mumbai sentenced a 26-year-old man from Mahim, Afzal Sayyed, to life imprisonment on Tuesday for murdering his mother in 2015. The prosecution said Sayyed argued with his mother over household expenses since he couldn't contribute due to his reduced salary. After attacking her, he informed his father that she was lying in the bathroom.

382.title: Was selling soya biryani, people said it's non-veg, abused us: UP vendor
382.article_body: Mohammad Sajid, who sells biryani in Uttar Pradesh said he started selling soya biryani after being told to not sell non-vegetarian biryani till Navratri is over. "Some people came...they asked what food I was selling...I told them its soya biryani...They kept saying I was selling non-veg...my stall had been flipped. They were abusing us...We even lost around ₹15,000," Sajid added.

383.title: Aus building hypersonic missiles to ensure stability in Indo-Pacific: PM
383.article_body: Australia's involvement in building hypersonic missiles with AUKUS counterparts US and UK is an effort to achieve stability in Indo-Pacific region, PM Scott Morrison said on Wednesday. Better defence capabilities would help Australia, should it get involved in any future war, he added. The move reportedly comes amid concerns by AUKUS allies over China's growing military presence in Pacific.

384.title: Video shows AIMIM corporator abusing police on night duty in Hyd; FIR filed
384.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that shows AIMIM Bholakpur corporator Mohammed Ghousuddin abusing policemen when they asked to close shops running past midnight in Hyderabad on Tuesday. The city police have registered an FIR in connection with the incident. In the purported video, the corporator is heard threatening the police team on night duty.

385.title: Worked with actors where I was uncomfortable, unsure of boundaries: Jacqueline
385.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez said that she has worked with actors in situations where she was "uncomfortable" and was not sure of "boundaries". "There are a lot of things that you have to take into account on certain scenes," she said, adding, "With John [Abraham], I've worked with him before so I understand the comfort level."

386.title: Mumbai doctor cheated of ₹40,000 by cyber fraudster
386.article_body: A 43-year-old Mumbai-based dermatologist was cheated of ₹40,000 by a cyber fraudster posing as customer care executive of ICICI bank. The fraudster told the victim that her credit card has been blocked as she didn't update her KYC. Seeing name of the fraudster's number as 'ICICI bank helpline' on Truecaller app, she shared OTP after which the amount was deducted.

387.title: One-and-half-year-old, mother fall off bike; run over by bus in UP
387.article_body: A bus ran over a one-and-half-year-old boy and his 26-year-old mother after they fell off a motorbike on the Etawah-Bareilly highway in Uttar Pradesh following which they died, police said. They were returning home on the bike of women's brother on Tuesday evening when the two-wheeler skidded, police added. The woman's brother sustained minor injuries, police further said.

388.title: Definitely want to do a full power action film, it's exciting: Bhumi
388.article_body: Actress Bhumi Pednekar has said that she "definitely" wants to do a "full power action film". "I have never done that. I want to see myself do that like some 'Matrix', some Lara Croft happening with Bhumi," she stated. Bhumi further said that she finds action films exciting and added that she is searching for such projects.

389.title: NDMC revokes order to let fasting Muslims leave office early during Ramzan
389.article_body: A day after passing an order to allow Muslim employees observing fast during Ramzan to leave their offices early at 4:30 pm, the Welfare Department of the New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) withdrew it. Notably, NDMC Vice-Chairman and BJP leader Satish Upadhyay had opposed the relaxation, which was supposed to be applicable from April 3 to May 2.

390.title: Bihar police officer asks for sexual favours from gang-rape victim, held
390.article_body: Bihar Police have arrested a Station House Officer [SHO] for allegedly demanding sexual favours from a 23-year-old gang-rape victim. The victim was allegedly gang-raped last year. "We talked to victim and established the veracity of her audio conversation with accused police officer. He threatened her to spoil case if she did not oblige," Gaya women's police station in-charge Ranjana said.

391.title: Extreme poverty in India less than 1% even during pandemic: IMF
391.article_body: Extreme poverty in India was recorded below 0.8% in 2019 and remained less than 1% even during the pandemic year 2020, a new report published by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) stated. Free foodgrain distribution under the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana (PMGKAY) was instrumental in preventing an increase in the extreme poverty levels, the report added.

392.title: Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker marry in Las Vegas, wedding not legal: Report
392.article_body: Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker got married at a chapel in Las Vegas hours after Grammys 2022 ceremony, as per a report by TMZ. However, the marriage is not legal since they didn't get a license for the same, TMZ added. They reportedly didn't allow the venue to take any photos, bringing their own photographer and security instead.

393.title: Kiraye ke tattu: Journalist to Pakistani minister as they argue during press meet
393.article_body: A video of Pakistan Minister Fawad Chaudhry arguing with journalist Matiullah Jan during a press meet is going viral on social media. After Chaudhry called Jan "a journalist on rent", he responded by saying, "Kiraye ke tattu aap honge Fawad Chaudhry." Jan could be seen heckling the minister outside Pakistani supreme court.

394.title: Website of Russian oil firm Gazprom Neft down; hack suspected
394.article_body: The website of Gazprom Neft, the oil arm of Russian gas giant Gazprom, went down on Wednesday after briefly displaying a statement by Gazprom CEO Alexey Miller. The statement cited Miller making critical comments about Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "The information published on the site...is not true and cannot be regarded as an official statement," Gazprom Neft said.

395.title: Govt's decisions will take India into situation like Sri Lanka: Mallikarjun Kharge
395.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Wednesday criticised the privatisation of public sector units and said that the decisions of the Indian government might take the country into a "Sri Lanka-like situation". "The inflation is continuously increasing across the country and the government is selling the public sector enterprises," Kharge added.

396.title: Russian astronauts were blindsided by yellow suits issue: NASA's Vande Hei
396.article_body: NASA astronaut Mark Vande Hei has said the Russian cosmonauts who arrived at the space station last month wearing colours of the Ukrainian flag were paying tribute to their university which has blue and yellow in its emblem. He added the astronauts were "blindsided" by the controversy over their spacesuits' colour. Vande Hei spent 355 consecutive days in Earth orbit.

397.title: Railways to make more overbridges to deal with waterlogging: Minister
397.article_body: Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said Indian Railways is making efforts to make more overbridges rather than road under bridges (RUBs). This will help in dealing with problems such as waterlogging in underground projects, he added. He further informed the Lok Sabha that Research Design and Standards Organisation (RDSO) has studied the issue in detail and offered remedial measures.

398.title: Ukrainian man avoids 'mined roads' to install SpaceX service in village
398.article_body: Ukrainian Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov took to Twitter to share an image of a man, installing a SpaceX Starlink station in Liubech, who "bypassed many mined roads to reach the village". "The village was occupied by [Russia] and cut from [Ukraine]...and now its citizens have access to the world," Fedorov said. Ukraine had asked SpaceX's help post Russia's invasion.

399.title: 30-year-old man arrested for vandalism in Puri's Jagannath temple
399.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested for allegedly vandalising the kitchen of Puri's Jagannath temple on Wednesday. The accused, identified as J Mohapatra, had allegedly vandalised the 'chulhas' (earthen stoves) at the temple as he was "feeling uneasy about something", police said. At least 43 earthen stoves, which are used to prepare the temple's 'mahaprasad', were found vandalised on Sunday.

400.title: Suryakumar might be a bit rusty: Aakash on MI's game against KKR
400.article_body: Talking about MI batter Suryakumar Yadav, who's likely to play in their match against KKR, cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra said the 31-year-old might be a bit rusty. "Because he hasn't played [in] a while...He will need to find some rhythm," added Aakash. Suryakumar missed MI's first two games and hasn't played any competitive cricket since February due to a finger injury.

401.title: Food ordering apps Zomato and Swiggy down
401.article_body: Food delivery apps Zomato and Swiggy on Wednesday reported a nationwide outage due to technical issues. Users took to Twitter and wrote, "Zomato and Swiggy are down! Food crisis has started!" and "Dude why are Swiggy and Zomato down at the same time?? Bhook lagi hai yaar." "How on earth both gone down at the same time?" another user tweeted.

402.title: Rihanna makes her debut on Forbes annual billionaires list
402.article_body: Pop star Rihanna is among the new entries in Forbes' Annual World's Billionaires List this year. The 34-year-old singer, who is expecting her first child, is worth $1.7 billion, according to Forbes. Her stakes in the Fenty Beauty cosmetics line and the Savage X Fenty lingerie business helped make her Barbados' first billionaire, Forbes said.
